Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChristineDunn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very accessible, and in a great location. Just hop on a 197 bus right outside Schipol airport, and it will take you to museum square right across from the hotel. It is in a quiet area, and there are many things to see around it e.g. concergebouw, Van Gogh and Rijk museums. To get into the centre, either hop on a tram in front of concertgebouw or you can walk (It's perhaps just over a mile, but all flat and lovely sights to take in!). Our room was on the ground floor and very spacious. The lady at reception warned us that it may be noisy around breakfast time, as the room was just outside reception and offered to show us another room. However, we didn't notice any noise at all over the three nights that we stayed. The bed was very comfortable too and we slept well! There is a good big shower, and bathroom is nice and modern. The floor was a little dusty in places, but it was clean otherwise. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. They offered good advice about tourist attractions and transport. They kindly kept our bags after we checked out as our flight was in the evening, so we were free to check out more of the city. We didn't get breakfast, but the cafe at the concertgebouw offers good breakfast for about 9 Euro 80 cents, which is slightly less expensive! There is a bakery around the corner (opposite the restaurant, 'Boeuf') which is cheaper again, if you want croissants, coffee etc and you can sit in. I would recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay again. It was very good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: smcelroy
Reviews.Content: I liked this place and its earthy nature and the staff were very pleasant. The rooms were nicely done and clean but I always like to have at least a bottle of water, which they didn't. Location is good with plenty to see around the hotel. It is about 15 min walk to central Amsterdam but a good way to see a little more of the city. Overall, very happy and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but walls are a little thin!”
Reviews.Author: Aisrory
Reviews.Content: great hotel and excellent location. staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were a good size and very clean.Excellent value for money. would definitely go back.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cagayan de Oro, Cagayan de Oro, Philippines
Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Matters”
Reviews.Author: Warren G
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the positive reviews we read and photos we saw. We weren't disappointed. Getting to the hotel from Schipol was easy, take the 197 Red Bus @4.00 euros per person, get off at Concert Hall (ask the driver to tell you when you're there, they never hesitate to do so). Hotel's location is perfect, situated in a quiet neighborhood but aside from the bus stop, the tram also stops right in front of the hotel. Should you prefer to walk, museums like Van Gogh, stores like LV or nightlife like Leidse are only walking distance. It's also worth mentioning that Albert Heijn supermarket is just nearby and closes at around 10 in the evening. The hotel makes it easier for first time tourists to get around by selling the iAmsterdam card that gives you unlimited access to select museums, complimentary river cruise and GVB tram/bus rides depending on the number of hours you purchase, cost ranges between 30-70 euros. What makes this hotel great and different from the rest is its staff's hospitality, we constantly asked for tips on where to go and they never failed to tell us with utter enthusiasm. And while you're there, please take some time to read their booklet about living conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round!!”
Reviews.Author: Colz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my partner in January 2012 and I have to say this is exactly what a city centre hotel should be. It was outstanding value at Â£48 a night, on a very easy direct bus route from Schipol (the number escapes me but it's listed in other reviews on here), it's spotlessly clean, and is an easy walk into all the interesting parts of Amsterdam. Will definitely stay again, as with the budget airlines doing very cheaps flights into Amsterdam you really can have a bargain of a break in a brilliant city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jarod M
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal at this hotel through Exedia. The room was well worn, however the location was great. I rented a bike for my stay and explored all of Amsterdam. There were great places to eat within walking distance and the hotel was on the main line to get to the airport. I wanted to explore the windmills outside of town and one of the hotel employees actually biked with me so i would know how to get here. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who asked. I also heard they had a newer sister hotel nearby so I will maybe try that one out on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Dorrra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. Not spectacularly good, nor bad. The room was very spacious, but not cosy. The Conscious hotel is just fine when you're in Amsterdam for a city break or a stopover, but I would not stay there for a week or so. It was a very nice gesture of the hotel staff to let us check-in approx. 3 or 4 hours early, since there was a room available. We had an early morning flight and the hotel was on the way from the airport to the town (very convenient 197 bus, 4 euro), so we stopped by to leave the luggage and refresh ourselves. We asked for an early check-in, in case there was such a possibility and they happened to have a free room (actually 2 rooms, so we had a choice). We didn't have breakfast in the morning, just a coffee (it costs 1 or 2 euro). After the check out we left the luggage at the hotel for the rest of the day and took it back on our way to the airport around 6pm - no problem there. When it comes to location: it's very close to public transport but quite far from city centre. We walked the distance once, but it's better to take a tram, since there is a lot of walking later on anyway. It would definitely be easier to have a hotel closer to city centre. Overall it's a good and clean hotel with friendly staff and more or less good location

Reviews.Title: “so comfy!!!”
Reviews.Author: glenmoe
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights, and i found the place to be spotless and spacious. the room was good size, and the nature feel in the room was really nice touch. the bed was so comfy and best sleep ever in this bed :) staff so friendly and helpful. the 197 bus from the airport drops around the corner from here. for the tram, get of at muesem square again around the corner. it is beside the Van Gogh museum and a local supermarket. trams bring you everywhere but also a walk away from all the must see and do!!!! i found the hotel to be very central to everything. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a handy location”
Reviews.Author: Voyager5792
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Conscious Hotel Museum Square which location is perfect to visit Amsterdam. The hotel staff is really friendly and is always there to help you. The room was nice & most important clean and the beds were very comfy. We travelled with our 5-year-old daughter and requested a room big enough to accomodate the 3 of us and a garden view (to follow the recommendations of other travellers). We got a huge room on the floor ground with 4 beds and access to the garden! The only negative thing is.... breakfast which is really expensive for what it is (13 â‚¬/pers), so I would definetely recommend you to book a room in this hotel but to have your breakfast elsewhere (many places offer fair breakfast for about 8 â‚¬ in the city centre). PS pour les franÃ§ais (for French people) : 1 personne de la rÃ©ception parle le franÃ§ais.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: anncoursey
Reviews.Content: stayed here mid February 2012, great beds, modern hotel, great location if you are doing lots of activities in the museum district of Amsterdam, the tram system is so good, u can stay anywhere though....... very friendly staff........would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “fab for a short stay away from the hustle”
Reviews.Author: Paula H
Reviews.Content: just the place for exploring the city if you only have a couple of days. Only 10 mins on the tram to dam square or a 5 min walk to van gogh museum. staff were so helpful, email them first to find out which bus etc to get from the airport. room is basic but clean but what else would you expect from an eco hotel fab stay and free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Fab ecofriendly different hotel”
Reviews.Author: Micalma
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an excellent location, very tastefully ecorated with all eco friendly materials, tables made from recycled coffee cups or yogurt pots, it was a breath of fresh air. Really a hotel with a difference. Helpful staff, very spacious rooms, large comfortable beds, good decoration, very warm, the only negative thing we couldnt find how we could reduce the temperature in the room which was quite hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large room, good breakfast and welcoming team”
Reviews.Author: Amazino
Reviews.Content: great location for both the RAI and centre of Amsterdam. Friendly staff, large room and good breakfast. Free wifi too

Reviews.Title: “Smooth, quiet and central located”
Reviews.Author: Bartho0
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the Museum Quartier, with a special concept: eco-friendly! The room was very spacious, had a nice bed and it was modern. Everything was clean and the bathroom was also spacious. Breakfast (Ã  â‚¬ 13,50) was goog enough, but fresh-cut fruit would be nice.The hotel is located right behind the Concertgebouw and the Museum Square, so all the major museums around the corner. 15 min walk to downtown Amsterdam. But also the Neighborhood (Oudzuid) is a nice place to stay. We paid â‚¬ 89 for one night, well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: buncie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Amsterdam after spending a birthday weekend there with friends and family. It was in a superb location off the main drag but close enought to walk everywhere. The staff were funny and friendly, and made sure we were felt most welocme. We were given a map with little areas to visit and allowed us to go to a local flea market and catch some great brown cafes (eeties) not coffee shops ! along the way. The area at the back of the concert hall and to the left had lovely local bars, perfect to a nightcap on the way back. I would definately recommend this lovely hotel. Shuttle bus from Airport is red bus no197 drops you right outside, and picks you up across the road cost 4 euros Thanks guys.... x Barb Bristol

Reviews.Title: “Great location super quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelster71
Reviews.Content: Amazingly comfortable beds, super quiet room and hotel in general, and very helpful and friendly staff. We also really liked the neighborhood - lots of restaurant choices, near the park (we went for a run each morning) and an easy walk to the canals. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: spoonfitter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights. We had a room on the fourth floor at the back of the hotel. We found it very quiet, generally, the breakfast was perfectly acceptable, and the staff were really super friendly and helpful. In particular, the young gentleman called Roel, assisted us with lots of advice and was a nice friendly face to pass on our way in and out. Everyone else was fabulous too. Even the housekeeping team took an interest when they found out it was my 40th birthday. I decided to book to visit the Anne Frank House but then found I needed to print off the tickets with a barcode. I was able to email them to the hotel and they printed them off for me, quickly, with a smile, and without any request for payment. The hotel is well placed for the 5 and 16 trams. When returning to Schiphol I would recommend the red 197 bus which stops about 60 seconds walk away from the hotel. It costs a mere 4 euro and takes you straight to the terminus in about half an hour. Just pay the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S S
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay for a long weekend at the beginning of January 2012. This is a small hotel which keeps things modern, clean and simple. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and the hotel and our room were modern and spotlessly clean. Our room was not huge, so probably most suited for a shorter stay, but it is possible that a larger room might be available. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. The location just down the road from the ConcertGebouw and Museum Plein was great, with excellent transport links and it was safe and quiet, being mainly residential. Breakfast was a lovely, fresh continental style, mainly organic and with fresh scrambled eggs and bacon. We would like to particularly thank Roel on reception who was very helfpul and friendly, as were all the staff. Hot Tip: get the Number 197 bus from and to Schiphol - it stops a few metres from the hotel and only costs 4Euro per person. We found it easier to negotiate and better value than the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: D-Dog101
Reviews.Content: I found it quite difficult to get a good hotel for a reasonable price in Amsterdam and was very happy with my choice save for a few tiny quibbles. Location De Lairessestraat is a quiet area but within walking distance of some excellent restaurants and bars. If you want to be in the heart of Amsterdam, this may not be for you but the city is so small that it is only a twenty minute walk to the main areas. It is right beside Museumplein and the Van Gogh Museum and the Concertgebau. To get into town take the 5 tram. Buy a ticket (7euro for 24 hours) at the hotel reception. Thanks to another tripadvisor we discovered the bus 197 from Schiphol to De Lairessestraat (the stop is Museumplein). And it cost just four euro! That compares to 15 euro for one of the airport shuttle buses. Style/Character This is a very clean, modern and simple three star hotel. It has an eco 'face lift' that marks it out from others. There are nice touches such as a wall made entirely of plants in the reception area. Service The staff was the friendliest and most helpful I have come across in a long time. We encountered four members and each were excellent. We forgot to bring a european adaptor and the hotel staff obliged by lending one for free. We didn't have to pay a deposit. Rooms Spotlessly clean. Very comfortable beds. Our room was advertised as a double but it was a twin when we arrived. Nice touch with the decor- instead of bedside tables there were two tree trunks and the light covers were bamboo. The shower was powerful. Two minor quibbles: the lights were much, much too dim and a light sleeper would be distracted by the noises from other rooms such as doors banging. Food/drink There is no restaurant here but a short walk away there are a few. I recommend the Bark- a seafood eaterie with the butterfish a good choice. Also there is a wee 'brown' pub behind the concertgebau called something like Wengel (?), which was lovely and cosy. A note on breakfast. It costs 13 euro if you pay that morning and 10 euro if you pay the night before. We opted to walk and scout out other places to eat instead. Bagel and Beanz is nearby and is much cheaper. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, comfortable accommodation and excellent service, why pay more elsewhere?”
Reviews.Author: TashBeestie
Reviews.Content: Not a luxury hotel, but it was comfortable and staff was very helpful. The rooms were very basic, no toiletries or tea-coffee facilities, however I found our room to be very spacious, there was at least 2.5 m between the end of the bed to the wall which is extremely spacious by European standards! It was also spotlessly clean. The staff was very friendly, one looked for 5 mins out the back when I borrowed a kettle, another told us about a bus that we could take to the airport right outside the door that we didn't know about (instead of a bus and a tram), and generally we felt very welcome. Location is right next to museumplein, which is good for the museums but a bit of a walk to the city. However the trams are right there and they come every two minutes so very easy to get around. All in all, a very good value budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well.... depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: michaeledwards7
Reviews.Content: Location was good. However, this was not what I would consider a vacation hotel. Continental breakfast, but the room was very drab. No AC had to borrow a small fan. The hotel itself was not pretty. We only stayed one night as a stop over before moving on to another location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, great choice”
Reviews.Author: Mighty-Red
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not top-notch luxurious but is a real find for overall package and value. Reception Staff Without exception the staff we interacted with were excellent. Nothing was too much trouble and very knowledgable. A real credit to the hotel. An early check-in was not a problem and our room request was met exactly. More than willing to store our bags securely from check-out to early evening. Location Virtually opposite the Concertgebouw and very close to the big museums. A very easy tram ride (5 or 16) to the city centre, and an easy and cheap bus transfer (197, 4 Euros) to Schiphol means that everything is within easy reach yet the hotel is in a calmer district. Probably about a 40 minute walk to the Central Station if you feel so inclined. Room Small, but spotless with a comfortable bed, air-con, very decent bathroom, good TV choice and free safe. Good quality bedding and towels; the toileteries provided are just soap & liquid wash. Lift to all floors. Breakfast Not the biggest choice in the world but excellent quality and ample quantity. Our tariff included breakfast and we certainly made use of it. Would we stay here again when visiting Amsterdam? Certainly, without the slightest hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: grlfrmnsk
Reviews.Content: There are only two reason I didn't give this hotel a five. First because the soundproofing between rooms was poor. Fortunately my neighbors were quiet but I could still hear them talk and the second reason, which is not the hotel's fault but just something I'm used having, was no mini fridge or a coffee pot in the room. It would have been nice to have a place to make some coffee in the morning or store a cold bottle of water. Besides those two minor issues the hotel was fantastic. It's practically around the corner from the Van Gogh museum and short walk to the Rijk museum. The area is more residential, but only minutes away from the town center. If you want a nice hotel that's away from all the noise and traffic of the center city, this hotel is perfect. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There are lots of excellent restaurants near by. The public transportation is fantastic and will take you to the center in minutes or you can even walk. The room was clean and spacious. The queen size bed is actually two twin beds next to each other. Over all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for our girl's weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam with a group of friends I would certainly pay a return visit. The beds were extremely comfortable and by trying out spare pillows in the wardrobe it is possible to find a perfect combination! Although the hotel was fully occupied there didn't seem to be much noise. For us the location was ideal, the area has a great feel to it and is quiet, with only a short walk to several of the museums and really easy access to trams and buses. We didn't breakfast in the hotel but found a fabulous bakery (one of many) a short walk away. The rooms were spacious and clean. Everything is simple but tasteful. The hotel staff were great, friendly and helpful, they assisted us with booking museum tickets and even checked us in to our return flights online. Overall our experience here was wonderful. The lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room was the only negative, but we took our own travel kettles etc so this wasn't a problem. There are also kettles available to borrow from reception and the staff were happy for us to borrow cups from the breakfast area. We were a large party, 10 of us in a combination of 3 and 2 night stays, visiting a friend who lives in the city. The reception staff quickly linked us together and made us feel very welcome. If I return to Amsterdam, as I hope to some time, I will certainly be looking to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Mark v
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotel.com. Easy to reach by metro/tram. Good value for the money. The bed in our room really needs replacement, else it would have had more points. Bathroom is OK, but needs some attention. Breakfast sufficient, not much but enough, all biological products. Close to the Museumplein, so close to the musea and concertgebouw. But also walking distance to the city-centre (Leidscheplein).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: tractorgirl2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 2 nights at this hotel. Ideal location, if you don't mind walking a bit, as not central. Trams run right past the door, as well as buses and the airport bus stops just across the road- 4 euros each way and about a 30 minute direct journey. Hotel was excellent, staff friendly & very helpful. Rooms clean, nicely decorated and beds to die for- so comfy. Air con in some rooms, which wasn't a problem for us, as it was a winter trip, but suspect it would be nice in summer. Amsterdam is not cheap, but no where on the continent is at the mo for british travellers with the euro, but it is a major city so expect to spend. Off of Dam Square there are lots of little restaurants which do deals 'tourist menus' which do work out cheaper to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Cullies
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great - lovely big spotless rooms with tv, lots of wardrobe space, well equipped clean bathrooms with plenty of towels (we had just a shower but the other room our friends had did have a bath too), air-con, memory foam mattresses and pillows (yes really!!) and windows you could actually open properly. I had one of the best nights sleep I have ever had in a hotel here. Breakfast was not the biggest selection I have ever seen but it was unlimited and very very nice - plenty to satisfy most people. Staff were uber-helpful and friendly with maps, advice and tips which went a long way to make out stay easier. Hotel open 24 hours so no worries about being late (or early!), it had a quiet family feel to it which suited us but might not suit stags or hens!! Location of this hotel is really good - Seconds from both the Van Gogh and the Riyksmuseum. A 5 minute walk from there and you are in Leidseplein with all the shops and restuarants anyone could want and boats for canal trips. From there it is a lovely 10 minute walk to Dam Square with all its attractions and Anne Frank House. From Dam square a further 10 minutes walk to Grand Central Station and the Red light District. There are also many markets within 10/20 minutes walk too - perfect. From the airport take a red bus, no 197 and this will take you directly into the city and it stops 50m from the hotel door (4 euros each way - much cheaper and easier than train and tram). When we read the reviews on here before we went we couldn't believe that the hotel was as good as everyone said it was for the price but believe it because it really is. We have stayed in Amsterdam and other cities before and paid a lot more for a great deal less. We would not hesitate to go back and strongly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Brittany C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Conscious Hotel in August and absolutely loved it. Location was excellent for picking up the train to see the sites. Front desk staff was so helpful by the end of our stay I would almost say we were friends. Very clean and comfortable, we had a balcony which we request when we booked. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic for the price”
Reviews.Author: lucrece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, 100 m from the tramway station, and from the Van Gogh and Rijks Museum.The satf is courteous and efficient. Our room was very large, and the bedding ok but hardish pillows. But the hotel is very basic. Under cover of being conscious of our environment,all the stuff used in the hotel is very cheap and common, this is an ikea hotel, with leaves stickers on the wall. there are economic lights in the bathroom, and it is very dark. A soap distributor + a shower/shampoo one . No ear sticks or hair cap or anything else (small things that you don't want to carry for a w.e). Therefore I don't believe this is a good value for the money they charge. I will return to Amsterdam and next time choose instead a hotel closer to Dam or Leisedplein.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: JMEandKB
Reviews.Content: The front desk was a great help - directions and early check-in. The location is great for a quiet stay but attractions outside of the museum complex are pretty far away. Positives- good value, Negatives- no Internet on upper floors

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Jokummrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and I feel confident in recommending this marvellous hotel. Conscious is a fantastic hotel in a number of ways. We travelled with a baby and were warmly greeted and had a large, comfortable room. The facilities are extremely clean and modern. We loved the organic self serve breakfast with fresh bread, eggs, cereal and fruit.n the staff are friendly and welcoming. Finally, the location is fabulous. Outside your door is a tram and bus service. On Saturdays we visited a farmers market in Jacob Obrechstrat. I love

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with a few kinks”
Reviews.Author: KimHolland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in October. When checking in, it turned out we had accidentally booked for a wrong weekend but thankfully there was one room left. The check-in person was very pleasant and helpful. The room was ready in 3 hours so we went for a walk around the Museumplein and when we got back, we were informed the price for the night was 146 euros which was much more than the original booking. I understand that can happen if there's only one room left but I would've appreciated to be given this information straight away so we could've looked elsewhere too. The room was a good size, clean and towards the garden which I would recommend as there's a busy street with a tramline on the other side. The decorated wall is very pretty but the remaining 3 look a bit ignored as someone pointed out earlier. Bathroom is a good size. There is no air conditioning which will be a problem summer time as the sun was shining in the whole day. We kept the "balcony door" (there was no balcony though, just the door next to some railing) open but in October it was too chilly to keep open all night. Sound isolation between the rooms isn't great and you can hear people walking in the corridors and the doors closing so I'd recommend bringing ear plugs. Our phone wasn't working the whole time either. Breakfast was 10 euros and OK - nice plum juice and different kinds of pastries and coffees, scrambled eggs were cold and there was only 1 kind of ham and cheese though. The Breakfast room is very pretty and even had some Marimekko pillows which is always a bonus :) My husband had forgotten some items (a CD and a post card) in the room which were handed to us when we came to pick up the luggage, which was great. If you get a room for the usual price then this is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: unplainjane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for our second visit to Amsterdam. We stayed in Museumplein last time so we were looking for an affordable hotel in the same area. Hotel Conscious was the cheapest one in the area at about $170 a night. It is in a great location right by the Museumplein tram stop. Though we walked everywhere and only used the tram for getting here from the airport. Btw if you come from the airport go to Zuid station and then take the #5 tram. Itâ€™s much quicker then going to Central Station and less hectic. We arrived early on a very rainy day and thankfully our room was ready as we were soaked. The main reception lady we encountered was very friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel is very modern and clean. Last time we stayed at an older hotel in a traditional Dutch house. I kinda missed that aspect of it here. The room was very spacious with comfortable bed. In terms of dÃ©cor I found it funny that one side of the room with the bed was decorated very nicely with â€œforestâ€� wallpaper and nice tree end tables. Though the other side of the room with the TV was completely white. Itâ€™s almost like they forgot to decorate the other side. Even though the hotel is on a main street it is very quiet and the room had big windows which was very nice. The breakfast was an additional 13.50 euro which we thought was really expensive so we bypassed that. We had breakfast at a really nice bakery around the corner south on Van Baerlestraat at a fraction of the cost. We rented bikes from the hotel which was really convenient. I believe it was about 7 euro for 3 hours and 13 euro for 24 hours. For dinner in the area I would recommend CafÃ© Pompa for tapas and CafÃ© Loetje for great steak and fries. I had no complaints about Hotel Conscious and I would definitely recommend it. Though if you want to experience a hotel thatâ€™s more traditional dutch feeling this isnâ€™t it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ddrCanada
Reviews.Content: Price was right. Location was great. Staff and room was really good. Very close to Vondelpark and museums. A tram stop is right outside the front door and tram 16 takes you right to Dam Square and Central Station. We chose to park at the Olympic stadium (close by and only 8 euro/day). Again just take tram 16 and it go to the centre. GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever!! Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jr02gm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I cannot speak more highly of our stay at this hotel. We arrived three hours before check in time after a long flight just to see if we could check our bags. The front desk staff said not only do they allow you to check your bags, but our room was in fact ready! Being able to check in early was a godsend because we were so tired. The beds were incredibly comfortable. The room is sparse, but had everything we needed. The neighbourhood is beautiful and so close to several museums (as the name suggests). It was also close to the theatre, which offered student prices, and a wide range of yummy restaurants. Particularly, a pizzeria located in a small square near the hotel. At the end of our long day of exploring the city, we slept soundly in the room, which was very quiet despite being close to a main road. However, we slept too soundly and awoke only half an hour before the check out time. Once again, the front desk staff said not to worry and we were able to check out 15 minutes late. The comfort these kindnesses afforded us was invaluable and set us up for a great stay in Amsterdam. You will not be disappointed with your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, close to the museums”
Reviews.Author: NORTHVANC
Reviews.Content: We loved Amsterdam! Booked the family room and found large room with queen bed and single bed - perfect for our needs. Huge windows onto the back garden so it was bright and airy during the day. Simple decor, very clean room and bathroom. It was exactly as described in all the marketing materials. The front desk was very friendly and helpful - they even directed a phone call from friends to us at a restaurant around the corner! Location was perfect - close to museums and walkable to other sights. We chose not to have breakfast at the hotel and - often had a light breakfast at the Opera House across from the hotel. Only criticism was the room lighting - energy saving bulbs which would eventually get bright but the lamp shades were dark brown so there was not much light. We would stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price, decent location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vtailor81
Reviews.Content: Service was friendly and accommodating. The staff behind reception were more than happy to give us maps and pinpoint attractions, tram stops etc for us. The room was excellent. Very spacious, modern minimalist design. The bathroom was clean and modern with organic soap and shampoo available. Towels were clean and soft. The shower looked brand new the only downside was that the shower screen left a gap between the bathtub which allowed water to leak out onto the floor. The room also included a flat screen tv, alarm clock and radio. There was a free to use safe in the room which was handy for storing valuables, we were given a key at check-in. The location is by the van gogh museum, there is a tram stop outside for tram 16, or around the corner for tram 5 both take you to central station in around 10 minutes. An organic buffet breakfast was included and was excellent. Scrambled eggs, fried eggs, sausages, various bread, juices, yoghurt's, muesli, fruit, coffee/tea all included. I'd definitely come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay I've had in Europe, affordable for all sorts of travellers”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: I just spent a few weeks traveling throughout Europe and I must say, this is the best experience I've had with hotels. We were a group of five, split between two rooms, and we couldn't have asked for better accommodations. From the moment we walked in, the staff was courteous, excited, and anxious to help us. Our rooms were incredibly large and very well kept. The larger of the two rooms, which slept three, was massive. It had a double bed with a separate little annex with a single, and a roomie bathroom. But what put everything over the top was the service. The staff was always smiling, very talkative, and genuinely interested in helping us make the most of our experience in Amsterdam. The rates were incredibly fair and I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wery good place and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Olga P
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel! Excellent location, near all the museums, a very nice area! We would like to thank all the employees of this hotel for their consideration and understanding! We especially want to mention staff ROEL and YAEL(housekeeping) for help.Whey are great person. Excellent room cleaned, great breakfast Room is comfortoble, but no refrigerator! This is not good!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: mossup
Reviews.Content: I brought my girlfriend here for our first trip to Amsterdam. At first I was concerned that it was too far from the city centre but in the end it was perfect. The location meant that we walked everywhere and got to see so much more of the city that we would've otherwise missed at another central hotel. Being out first time here we had many questions for the staff at the hotel who were always very accommodating and knowledgeable. They recommended some great places to see and places to avoid, helping us feel less like tourists. The room was great although difficult to see the room numbers at first [TIP: They're on just above the door handles in really small print] . The beds were very comfy and inviting after a long day walking the streets. The breakfast buffet is limited but there's enough to get your day started. Overall we couldn't have picked a better hotel for our budget. We highly recommend it here.

Reviews.Title: “i promised myself i would come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carmen_Serbanescu
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel: excellent location in the old city center (we became specialists in using the trams with stops just in front of the hotel); friendly staff and kind persons (always willing to help us with advises and good hints for visiting the city); cozy rooms and garden... we congratulated ourselves for choosing this hotel for our 6 days stay in Amsterdam... we will come back here for sure and we will recommend it to all our friends... Amsterdam wouldn't have been so nice without staying at Conscious Museum Hotel.... Thanks a lot! Carmen & Irina

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: tarryn222
Reviews.Content: What exactly is this hotel "conscious of"? The only "conscious thing" is that they offer organic milk for breakfast (which you have to pay for!), and they use "eco friendly soap" (which they didnt even remember to fill up in our bathroom so there was no soap. There were so many things wrong with this hotel: - Bad location (its out of the city centre and you need to take a tram or bus into town) - The carpets in the passage are stained (gross) - The paint on the walls in the room were dirty - The walls were so thin we could here the next door neighbour sneeze and cough and we could hear their TV. - When we switched on the lights they were so dim you could hardly read a book - The beds were so soft! they had big dents in the middle of the bed. We dragged the mattress off the bed and had to sleep on the floor. The matteress were dirty underneath when we took them off the bed. - The safe was from 1922 and did not work, nor were there any instructions on how to use it - There were no tea/ coffee making facilities (which is what we had come to expect from our expereinces in other hotels at this price range) - There were no moisturisers, shower caps, shampoos in the bathroom. The bottle of soap in the shower was empty because noone had bothered to fill it up. - At this price the breakfast wasnt even included (which is what we had come to expect from our experiences in other hotels at this price range) What a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Huge comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: hellochangelings
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a trip to Amsterdam where we stayed at Conscious Hotel. The room was approx Â£258 for 3 nights. The hotel is quite far from the main hub of action in the city but there is a tram stop right outside and they run until midnight so if you party until the early hours prepare for a very long walk home. The road that the hotel on is quite upmarket and consequently has a good few pretty shops and nice cafes. Although the area is not crowded with people, the road is quite busy and I found the constant hum of traffic during the night a little difficult to get used to - would be ok if you sleep with the window closed but there was no A/C so that wasn't an option in August - p.s watch out for mosquitoes. Hotel decor was quite nice and modern but nothing really special - not a real wow factor but it was lovely and clean and had the biggest and most comfortable bed (very firm mattress FYI) I have ever slept in. Great quality bedding and pillows too. Shame there was no kettle in the room but there was a hairdryer which was a bonus. Shower was also great. Staff were quite friendly but nothing over the top. Last tip...take yr own teabags if you like english style tea as they only have herbal and earl gray available at the bar but they give you a glass of boiling water so it's easy to use yr own stash :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for city break”
Reviews.Author: evemonn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an upmarket, quiet area 5 minutes from the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk Museum. There are tram and bus stops outside the hotel and also an extremely handy bus connection to the airport. It is also a pleasant, easy walk into town and the Leidseplein and Max Euweplein areas are close by with cafes, restaurants and bars. The hotel is modern, minimal, and no frills. When we first arrived at the front door / lobby area, I was a little disappointed. The lobby is small and plain, the decor minimal. However our room was very spacious (Amsterdam rooms are typically small) with a large well appointed bathroom, Tv, Wardrobe etc. As I said its minimal in design but everything you need is there. We had breakfast in the hotel on the last morning which was fine, but to be honest i think your better off eating in the vicinity. There are lovely cafes within walking distance. We had great food in a restaurant nearby called Pompa - excellent. I would stay here again as the location and price are hard to beat in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Vaney
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in May 2011. It was clean, spacious (for a European hotel), friendly, and pleasant. The location is excellent..around the corner from the Concertgebouw and directly on a major tram line. Staff was friendly and informative. I would definiteiy return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a nice "concept hotel"”
Reviews.Author: thevalheruox
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a very nice neighbourhood and is a few meters away from 2 major tramlines. the rooms are clean, the beds are big and comfortable. the employees are also helpful and kind. the only issue we faced during our visit was the WLAN - in the upper floors it was not working properly. In the lobby internet access was fine. One tip; ask for a hair-dryer while you are checking they are not in your room by default but are lended to you during your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bomani
Reviews.Content: Visited Amsterdam for 3 days in May with my wife. At first we thought we had made a mistake in choosing this hotel but quickly learned otherwise. Just 2 blocks to 2 major tramlines that circle all of the areas visitors are most interested in. Some rooms (ours) are small so request a larger one but they are all comfortable. Front desk is very helpful with information and guidance.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Eco-Hotel, But Not The Best Out There”
Reviews.Author: LolaWantsandGets
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good -- it is a 15-25 minute walk to the heart of Amsterdam from the hotel, which may or may not be so good for some people. It IS close to Vondelpark, the Van Gough Museum and the Rijksmuseum (museumplein) so if you want to visit those places, it is very convenient. The size of the double room and bathroom was very spacious for Amsterdam. I appreciate their commitment to the environment, I really do. However, the bed was weird and the pillows were lumpy, and the towels were thin and rough. There is such a thing as eco-luxe but maybe this is too much for the price range of this hotel? I could tell that originally the mattress must have been awesome -- all soft and fluffy. But after god knows how many guests, the middle of the mattress was worn down and it was kind of like sleeping in a hammock or canoe. And those lumpy pillows -- what is up with those?? Not comfy at all. And the spare ones in the closet were only marginally better. They were soft, but too soft and don't support your head or neck properly. The room itself was very clean, as was the bathroom. They claim the carpets are eco-friendly, but how clean can they really be when people are trekking in shoe dirt from Amsterdam? Also, although free wi-fi is advertised in their literature, if you are staying on the 4th floor, you will just not get wi-fi at all, on a laptop or on your mobile. You will have to go and sit in the lobby for a signal. The lobby is nice and comfy and all, but I'd rather sit in my room and use the internet. There were no amenities in the room in terms of food or drink. If you wanted a coffee, you could go down to the lobby to get one, but they will charge you 1.25 euro for it. There were very few toiletries (hand soap, shampoo) for amenities in the bathroom. One more thing: I wouldn't say the hotel is quiet since the walls were kind of thin, and the hotel is located next to a school. I could hear my neighbors' music, conversations and cavorting, and in the mornings I was awakened by screaming schoolchildren playing outside. It wasn't a bad hotel, I just don't know if I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a quite basic hotel with a very decent bed but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: ullcosta
Reviews.Content: Located nearby Vondel Park, which makes it about 15 min to the city center by foot - a good location if you are driving there - 24 euros/day to park the car on the public streets. The room had a decent size and it was clean. The bed was pretty good. The staff was appropriate and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic staff will be back”
Reviews.Author: sweethart241
Reviews.Content: stayed here 21st april for husbands birthday, was supposed to be staying at hotel next door but they were a complete sham, this hotel however was polar opposite, they couldnt help us enough in finding alternate accomodation as they only had rooms for one night, they hotel was fantastic and the staff couldnt do enough for you will be going back again and again thanks again museum square!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with fantastic beds”
Reviews.Author: C_Bridge85
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night only but it was definately the best sleep of our trip. In the meseum quarter, its great for museums and a short walk to one of the central squares for cafes, bars and resturants. The eco theme is quite quirky but it is quite a basic hotel. However, our room and bathroom was spacious and spotless with a large plasma screen TV and VERY comfy beds. The value was quite good overall and we were pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “reception staff the best”
Reviews.Author: Flowerpower_11
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, especially upon arrival. Lady at the reception desk ( Lisa) was very welcome , gave us lots of tips and after 10 minutes and a glass of water, she had a room available. But everybody at the reception was great and doing much more then expected. Breakfast is ok (â‚¬10 ) , allthough in the weekend we had sunny side eggs , but during the week the breakfast guy did not make them?! Must say the spanish guy in the weekend , was more polite and friendly , then the grumpy guy during the week. It does not cost anything to say goodmorning!! Also he took more time by filling up the buffet. We had to ask several times for more juices and bread.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful space, fantastic staff, cozy, charming and great location”
Reviews.Author: whatthetravellersaw
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Conscious Hotel in Museum Square and found the place to be terrific. For the first five nights of my stay I had a beautiful room on the second floor overlooking the street. The noise didn't bother me a bit. I loved the comfy bed and being able to hop over to the Van Gogh Museum whenever I needed to. Breakfast was simple and good. But the staff were the strongest point. All lovely, charming, and friendly. Upon the return from my travels I was moved to another room on the fourth floor from which I could see the roofs of many nearby buildings. The next morning when I left everyone was so kind. And here's a real testimony. I left my laptop in the cab I took to the airport. Called the hotel frantically, and within minutes the cabdriver came back to the airport and returned my laptop to me. I recommend this place highly if you want a quiet place from which to see the city. It is walkable to the Dam and the markets...loved the environment.

Reviews.Title: “We have had a wonderful stay and consider this as one of the best hotels in Amsterdam> We will certainly come back soon!”
Reviews.Author: Aalbert
Reviews.Content: We have had a wonderful stay and consider this as one of the best hotels in Amsterdam> We will certainly come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Simply enjoyable - acting "green" was never more fun.”
Reviews.Author: pialaberlina
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself invites to relax between exhausting trips through Amsterdam. The Vondelpark in the back of the hotel is a perfect supplement to the green character of the Concious Hotel Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The Best.”
Reviews.Author: kemmy8810
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the second half of our honeymoon. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful! They helped us with directions to museums and even recommended excellent and affordable restaurants. Always smiling and very happy to help. Roel was our favorite! And then, the beds. Ah, the beds. So comfortable! Best sleep I've ever gotten. We plan to buy the exact bed. Thank you to all the staff there for making our trip so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “really good!”
Reviews.Author: klaire26
Reviews.Content: it was placed in a nice neighborhood , near a tram and a bus station. The reservations department was really helpfull and friendly , giving us lots of touristic informations. We extended our reservation and gave us a really good rate . The room was very clean and the beds really comfortable. the only thing tha was annoying is that they don't provide smokers rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Super, simple and spacious”
Reviews.Author: HelsinkiAnna
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 3-day stay at Museum Square Conscious Hotel. Both the room and the bathroom were very spacious and comfortable, and had a luxurious feel to it. At the same time the hotel felt very homey and simple. And all this for a good price. I can totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: RattiganOxford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Conscious Hotel Museum Square for three days in January and really enjoyed it. The staff are unfailingly kind and helpful and our room was attractive, clean and comfortable. The location is pretty good, although it depends a bit on what you want to do in Amsterdam. Certainly for some museums and the concert hall it is very good; getting elsewhere on the tram is quite easy. Breakfast wasn't the greatest, so I would recommend skipping that, but otherwise I thoroughly recommend this cool, ethical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Travellodge style hotel - but good for the museums.”
Reviews.Author: Juggernot
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent for the concert hall, museums (van gogh, reikmuseum and others), and for some decent, if expensive restaurants. The no .16 tram goes right past the door (see other reviews about the noise on the ground floor from this) and the 2,5 and 24 stop 100 yards down the street. We had some difficulty finding the hotel (it is on the same road as the main entrance to the concerthall, on the right looking out from the hall) and when we got there we were knackered and freezing! The first room we were sent to hadn't been cleaned and the bedding hadn't been changed. We were given another room which was fine. The rooms were small but quite nice, travellodge style, decent bathroom with a good shower. There is a TV with a few English speaking channels and a clock radio. There were however a couple of problems with the room. Firstly, the beds are two singles pushed together with a gap where they meet. We were away for a romantic weekend, this was most unromantic! I had expected the beds to be amazing from some of the other reviews, i wasn't a fan. I think they are memory foam which you either love or hate. Secondly, even though the canals were frozen due to sub-zero temparatures, the room was so hot we had the window opened for our entire stay. This was ok, but not great for the eco credentials! The receptionist was great, he gave us really useful map and talked us through where everything was, gave us some recommendations for restaurants etc. The night receptionist also ordered us a pizza when we came in wasted on a couple of the nights! We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on the breakfast, but there is a great wee deli about 200 yards down the road (turn left as you go out) which had great value and excellent quality mid morning snacks and lunches (we never got up til well after breakfast!) Overall, it was a decent hotel and was really quite good for the price. If you are looking for a cheap but clean and tidy base for the museums, particularly the van gogh or riekmuseum, then I would definitely recommend this, particularly if you are not a couple.

Reviews.Title: “booking cancelled by cheap operator”
Reviews.Author: keepmovinon
Reviews.Content: Like the reviewer below, we have had our booking December 8th, 3 nights for 2 persons, cancelled at very short notice and been offered a very unsuitable, clearly less appealing hotel as an alternative. Now left scrabbling to find another suitable hotel at very short notice. Change of Management was the reason given to us. This is totally unacceptable as they clearly could have moved us to their sister hotel. Vacancies still being advertised on their own site today. Bookers beware - this has spoilt our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: MopseyIdaho
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay here. The staff was helpful. We would stay again. Beautiful neighborhood to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute cancellation by hotel”
Reviews.Author: joleahy
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room at this hotel for 4 nights in November, back at the end of July through Alpharooms and paid the full amount online. Today we were informed that the hotel had transferred our booking to a different, clearly less attractive hotel 2km away, at 5 days notic, "due to unforeseen circumstances". Considering that they own a similar hotel very close by (slightly more expensive!) and that they are failing to honour the contract implicit in accepting our booking and full payment at very short notice, we believe they should have transferred our booking to their sister hotel. If you book with them through a cheap operator, expect to look for a new hotel just before you travel!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further. A great place from which to explore the city!”
Reviews.Author: cski40
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Amsterdam having stayed at the Conscious Hotel Museum Square for 2 nights and really it provided everything that I needed. It was clean and the beds were very comfortable (lovely linen). Awesome shower too! The staff on reception are so welcoming and helpful. It's not the most luxurious hotel in the world but as a comfy and welcoming base from which to explore Amsterdam.....it was perfect! We didn't eat breakfast in but found the short walk of approx 200m to the amazing concert hall worth it where you can have amazing coffee and a croissant for approx 4 euros a head. The hotel is situated in the museum quarter which is just 5 minutes away from the centre of the chaos but still very central nonetheless. There are some fantastic restaurants approx 3 minutes walk away all suggested by our host. We ate at Boeuf and Kjnip and weren't disappointed!!! There was a lot of game on the menu (venison, hare, wildboar) and they were delicious. The museum district is a lovely area to be in, pretty classy but we wanted to explore the city. Trams pass approx 50m from the front of the hotel and they will take you wherever you need to go. We were a 3 minute tram journey from the Diamond Museum, Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum....should really have walked! Amsterdam Central station is on the north side of town whereas the hotel is a little south so be prepared to take a tram ( No. 16 or 24) to the "Museum plein" which takes approx 10mins. The hotel is a 1 minute walk from the tram stop. On our way home we took a bus to Schipol Airport (No. 197 or 370). They leave outside the hotel every 15 mins and will take you direct to the airport which we found more easy than lugging suitcases across town and through central station. It is the same cost as a tram ticket and the train fare and much much easier!! It is about a 20 minute journey. Anyway. Would definately stay at the Conscious Hotel again. If you want somewhere cost effective, comfortable and cosy to stay look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel i have stayed in. Not the most glamourous but fantastic overall.”
Reviews.Author: psychonurz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels throuhout europe and whilst this does not stand up against the big names in terms of facilities available it makes up for it in other areas. Location was fantastic for museums. Supermarkets, bars restaraunts within a few strides. Expect a fair walk to the centre but i know the area and was aware of this, in fact that was part of the reason for choosing as it is very peaceful compared to the city centre areas. Very clean, large rooms ( wasa triple room however) , beds to die for !!!! large tv, central heating and great size bathroom. And of course its eco friendly. Staff were amazing (apart from one young grumpy receptionist) the rest of them were so friendly and helpful. You get a personal service, and feel welcomed. Even down to the room maids who were excellent. I will be going here again without question. A big thank you to the staff at consious Museumplein. Fouth time to amsterdam, but this was the most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in Museum area”
Reviews.Author: TysonLivingston
Reviews.Content: We arrived early but hoped to drop our cases off so that we could go sightseeing, however our rooms were ready for us, a double and a triple. The welcome was very friendly, leaflets were supplied before we could ask. There are several tram routes within a few minutes walk of the hotel which will take you to the main attractions. Only once did we wait more than 5 minutes for a tram and the 72 hour pass that we had purchased from the Tourist Information at the airport was the best way to get around. Each time we returned to the hotel we were recognised and greeted warmly. The rooms were spacious, plainly decorated but comfortable, as the beds must have been judging by the speed I fell asleep. I would happily recommend the hotel if you are looking for a convenient bed and breakfast base.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: JoJoker
Reviews.Content: Don't expect luxurious it's a 3* hotel. The room was very spacious and extremely clean. It has the main things you need plus a great and free wi-fi in the rooms. The housekeeping clean the room and change towels everyday. The hotel is very well located in a quiet street just beside Vondelpark, only a few minutes walking from van gogh museum and crossing the street you have several trams that you can take for wherever you want to go in Amsterdam. The front desk staff was always very helpfull and nice. When i return to amsterdam i hope to find again a nice deal with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It feels like a homecoming stay!”
Reviews.Author: mulswen
Reviews.Content: We spend 1 night at Conscious and had breakfast in the morning. The room was very nice with great furniture. The bed was comfortable and fresh. The breakfast was also great; the coffee was delicious (important that the coffee in the morning is good, makes you awake in a pleasant way!). Al together: we enjoyed our stay at Conscoius Hotel and it feels like home!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: josiePlymouth
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a great vacation in Amsterdam. Had a wonderful time. The weather was a bit rainy but we made the best of it . The conscious Hotel Museum Square had a great location. The trams stop right near the hotel to take you anywhere in amsterdam. The front desk fellow Roel was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and basic. Because the hotel is Green the lighting was very poor . Ask for a room in the back, street side is noisey and there is no a/c. IThe breakfast left a little to be desired....Powder eggs and half cooked bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, with very cheerful staff”
Reviews.Author: Borislondon
Reviews.Content: We had a very quiet and spacious room overlooking the garden, with a clean and spacious bathroom. The location was perfect for visiting the park and the art museums. One detail I liked was the reading lights beside the bed - very focused and effective! I was particularly impressed by the very efficient and enthusiastic lady in charge of cleaning. I mentioned in conversation that I was allergic to feathers (not even realising that the bedding contained feathers) and she flew into action replacing the pillows and duvet with cotton alternatives and was very gracious and seemed to genuinely enjoy her work. She mentioned that anyone with feather allergies should let them know ahead of time and they will have alternative bedding.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot believe this hotelÂ´s ranking in Tripadvisor!”
Reviews.Author: Harrogatedazza
Reviews.Content: With my planned budget for 3 nights in Amsterdam I thought I had found a real bargain with this hotel ranked, at the time 18th from 337 but we were quite disappointed. It is clean, the coco-mat bed extremely comfortable and the staff very helpful but our room, on the front, was too noisy with the windows open and was extremely basic. For half the price you can get a similar room in a Travel Inn in London and we thought that the breakfast was extortionate. However so was Amsterdam so maybe I am being too hard picking on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but No Airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: 13Ezra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in July and were surprised to find out the rooms we not airconditioned. My mistake (when I checked their website a/c wasn't mentioned); however, the discription of the hotel and the photos showed an ultra modern hotel. It was just like the photos showed - good location - very modern - very clean- a very friendly and helpful staff and a nice breakfast buffet. Only negatives were the lack of airconditioning and the lack of ice machines - they didn't even have ice buckets.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Pigcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Museum Square Hotel upon the recommendation of a family member. We could not have been more pleased. It's a very good value for the price, and the sustainability philosophy of the hotel ownership was a plus. The location is very convenient to Museumpleine with the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum just a short walk away (the Stedelijk Museum of modern art was completely closed for renovation and its reopening date keeps getting pushed back). The Concertgebouw is almost directly across the street and is one of the world's greatest venues for classical music. A good-sized grocery store is located underground at one corner of the Museumpleine and was very convenient to get drinks and snacks for our daily sightseeing. Vondelpark is also very close. It's a bit like Central Park is to Manhattan - greenery, ponds, picnic areas, concert stages - surrounded by some well-heeled quiet residential neighborhoods. There's a stand for rental bikes right outside the hotel, and the tram stops at either end of the block. Of course, several tram lines converge around Museumpleine so the hotel is very close to all of them. Our room was on an upper floor and was furnished with simple, modern furniture and conveniently designed light fixtures. It was very comfortable and spacious with a large operable window overlooking the street. Although a tram runs directly in front of the hotel, the room was very quiet. Air conditioning was available with a small wall unit that could be turned on and off with a remote control. The room had a long desk in addition to a flat-screen television. The bed was comfortable for me although a bit too soft for my tall boyfriend who felt like he was sinking to one side. The bedskirt had several dark smudges that should have been cleaned, but the rest of the room was spotless. Our travel agent was able to get breakfast included with the price, and the hotel had a nice range of offerings. Cooked eggs and bacon in addition to croissants, breads, cheeses and meats, yogurt, many cereals, juices, and fresh fruit. A self-serve machine can make a variety of coffees and hot chocolate. The dining area was sunny and cheerfully furnished with an outdoor terrace with lots of trees and flowers where one can also eat. The multi-lingual hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They were able to give us information on where to get half-price tickets for events as well as information about public transit, museum hours, etc. Make sure you check out the rack of business cards by the elevator - they offer discounts on restaurants, canal rides, museum entrance fees, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Complete disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Zaur_M
Reviews.Content: We booked for two nights at Conscious hotel, but when we arrived, some guy met us outside (he didn't let us even go inside the hotel), told us that they were overbooked and told us to go to the Memphis hotel about 300 metres away. That chap told us that the Memphis hotel was much better and that Conscious hotel would pay the difference in the rate. However, the Memphis hotel did not have the "green" status, which we wanted to experience when we booked our room at the Conscious hotel. In addition, we later realized that Memphis hotel had a much worse rating from all traveller rating sites (no. 160 vs no. 18 for Conscious on tripadvisor.com, for example). Finally, it was farther from the city center, which was also a big minus given that we were in Amsterdam with our 1.5-year old daughter and that there was a heavy rain on the day of our arrival. Anyway, this was a complete disappointment and we'll try to get a compensation for this. Be aware of this potential problem - they do overbook, so need to make sure you get the preferential allocation of rooms, not someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a genuine smile”
Reviews.Author: Crookeo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family to celebrate my birthday and can't fault it. We were made so welcome by the staff. Rooms were clean and comfortable. No frills but everything we needed for a relaxed stay (they even provided glasses and plates/knives for us to use to toast my birthday and cut my cake). Fantastic buffet breakfasts. Great location for everything Amsterdam has to offer. Staff had great local knowledge and offered advice on where to eat as well as great conversation about subjects ranging from Dutch colonial history to the national sense of humour - all in perfect english. They even posted on some posters we had left behind (bought from the nearby Van Gogh Museum. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully business or leisure will take me back here soon.”
Reviews.Author: mckaykarenj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Conscious near Museum Square for a weekend in July 2010. The hotel is situated on the edge of Museum Square within easy walking distance of the street market on Albert Cuyp Street (well worth a visit), the Heinieken Experience (definitely worth a visit!), the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. Being a couple of miles away from Centraal Station and the harbour it is convenient that there are 2 tram options with a tram stop not far away from the hotel. Check-in was effieicent. We had booked through Airmiles and despite Airmiles never having sent the voucher for the hotel (we did chase them for it and it was never received; same thing happened with a trip last year too), the hotel honoured our booking. At check in you will receive lots of good information about travelling around the area, points of interest and excursions. You can book excursions at the hotel desk and the tour bus will collect you from the hotel in the morning on the day of your trip. We stayed in room 20 which is on the ground floor next to reception. We had read other reviews that there is a lot of road noise at the front of the hotel - we weren't at all disturbed by road noise but the wall between our room and reception is paper-thin so you will hear every phonecall, every conversation, every guest and the kitchen door squeaking on its hinges. Between about midnight and about 6am the hotel is quiet however. The room decor is lovely with a tree mural on the wall behind the bed, bedside tables made from tree trunks and lights that looked like donner meat on the spit!! There was no air conditioning in our room but despite the warm temperatures outside we didn't find it too warm or stuffy in the room. The en-suite is lovely although the desing of the shower with the door opening out into the bathroom meant the floor floods and gathers in a puddle under the sink. The shower gel was empty when we arrived but everything else in the room was well presented. The hotel is an eco hotel. The lobby is flooded with natural light and one wall boasts an array of plants, just beautiful. There is a garden area behind the breakfast room for guests to enjoy the sunshine and it is lovely. Breakfast is a typical Dutch buffet with breads and pastries, cheeses and cold meats, eggs and bacon, cereal and fresh fruit. There are snacks and drinks available to purchase from the reception. WIFI is free of charge and security protected - request details from reception. Check out was efficient and we were able to leave our bags with reception while we went on a final day of sightseeing in and around Amsterdam. There is a discounted taxi rate if you book at reception, for getting to the airport. The fare advertised is 32 or 33 euros (I can't remember exaclty) but we were charged 35 euros by the driver. A bit cheeky but still better value than booking another private hire which would be closer to 45 euros. The people who have Conscious Hotel are opening another one in Vondel Park, not far from Museum Square, in October and I am looking forward to trying that one out during my next visit to Amsterdam. I love Amsterdam, the people, the buzz and the country and to find such a charming hotel run by people who genuinely love what they do, is the icing on the cake for me. I really hope my work or leisure trips take me to this part of Netherlands again soon; next time I won't have to spend anytime choosing my accommodation as it will undoubtedly be Conscious Hotel Museum Square or Vondel Park.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, with great staff”
Reviews.Author: hersh_k
Reviews.Content: Our family arrived in Amsterdam on July 13th -- the night when 800,000 fans celebrated the World Cup Dutch team's 2nd place victory. Streets were blocked off, transit was shut down. We walked a couple of kilometers with all of our stuff. We arrived hot and sweaty at the Conscious Hotel, and were greeted by very helpful, friendly, efficient staff. Our reservation, made through a 3rd party service, was inaccurate; no matter. The staff figured out a work-around, and helped us get settled away for the night. We rented hotel bikes and had a great trip. The breakfast was good. Wireless ok, great in the lobby, not so hot in the rooms. Beds very comfortable. But overall, the best thing? super helpful and friendly staff...

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly but try to get a room to the back of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie1909
Reviews.Content: Able to access our room 11am. Room was small, noticed other much larger ones along the corridor. Very clean. Bathroom excellent. Large hot and cold self service breakfast buffet. All staff friendly and attentive. Very well placed for the concert hall and the major museums and everything else in Amsterdam within an easy walk or short tram journey. Only drawback was the traffic noise from the street below - guess a room at the back of the hotel would be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Great option, definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: 5phish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Conscious Hotel for 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. There was only 2 of us but we were given the huge 4 person room on the ground floor (#16). It's a great room and loved having so much space. The only problem is it's located next to reception so it was a bit noisy in the morning if you want to sleep in. We arrived early in the morning expecting to drop off our luggage but were really pleased to find we could get into the room right away. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It's perfectly located for visiting museums and the concertgebouw. We had All in 1 passes so it was really easy to get out and about via trams 16 and 5.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: miracle21
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness is priority for me and the family hence finding a clean hotel at a decent price was difficult in Amsterdam. I was hopeful after all the reviews pointed to Conscious Hotel being one of the value for money yet super duper clean around. We were given the biggest room (room 16)...so big, it fit all 4 adults and we had room to perhaps do a little waltz dance even! Loved the garden view though the weather did not permit chilling about in the garden. The heater was turned off somewhere into the night though that was not such a huge issue with me. Liked the cleanliness of the room, the decor in particular...chic design! Very near the shopping area and the supermart, Albert Hejin!! Greatest pity was tram 16, the only tram that takes you from centraal station to the hotel was down during my stay..which resulted in alot more walking and getting lost as we dropped off at a further tram stop. Otherwise, loved the stay...!! Quiet neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bremen50
Reviews.Content: we had a great time. beds are comfortable, relaxing, organic, no artificial parfums, breakfast is good, nice atmosphere, staff is extraordinary, friendly and helpful, encouriging us to feel home, couldnÂ´t be better

Reviews.Title: “A Little Diamond”
Reviews.Author: AGandKG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last week having chosen the hotel largely because of the Trip reviews - and we weren't disappointed. Lovely large airy room (102), super bathroom with really spacious shower, spotlessly clean, very comfy beds - two twins side by side rather than a double. Service from frontdesk staff excellent. Hotel in nice area near the Concertgebouw (concert hall), about a 30 minute walk from the centre, with excellent bus and tram services (# 5 & 16). Thanks to a tip from a previous reviewer, we used the 197 bus from the airport - couldn't have been easier, took us to Concertgebouw and only cost 3 euros. We also found the Stop/Go bus which runs from Oosterdok along Prinsengracht to Waterlooplein an excellent way to explore the city (1e per trip). Breakfast at the hotel adequate but a little pricey (13.50 euros) - we found better options at the Concertgebouw Cafe and Bagels & Beans in Van Baerlestraat (400 yds away). Apart from that, we'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: onthemovemom
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online when I was stranded with my children in Amsterdam during the airport closures. There weren't many hotels with rooms available and we really feel fortunate to have found this one. Our room was spacious, the kids wished they had brought a football. It was clean, free wireless internet and a great breakfast. The staff were very helpful and the location was good. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hamble
Reviews.Content: A well-located, comfortable hotel with spacious bedrooms and bathrooms. The Reception was manned at all times by helpful, well-mannered people with impeccable English (and French.) Breakfast is served in a conservatory and is a copious buffet, regularly replenished. On arrival at the airport we boarded the Hotel Shuttle Bus and bought return tickets. You inform the reception of your leaving time and they arrange with the bus company for you to be picked up in time for your flight. Everything in Amsterdam seem to run smoothly, or at least that was the impression we left with after 4 enjoyable nights.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: faiweelolli
Reviews.Content: I could not sing the praises of this hotel enough, definitely not what I was expecting! The holiday was 3 nights in Amsterdam including breakfast for around Â£125 (including flights). Great value! There are 2 buses from the airport that will take you a 2 min walk from the hotel for a couple of euros, saving on taxi/transfer money. I can't remember the numbers of the buses but if you call the hotel or email them then they will be more than happy to help. The location of the hotel is great, 2 minute walk to the tram stop and then 15 mins on the tram to the city centre, we didn't walk it as it was very cold when we went but I imagine it wouldn't take too long. Get the tram to Leidsplein from the hotel or walk it and find a restaurant called Rancho - down the little road by the Pancake place, best ribs ever! Unlimited pork ribs (tender meat, delish BBQ sauce), yummy crisp chips and a salad for â‚¬13! The hotel breakfast was yum - I believe everything is organic and fairtrade but don't quote me on that! They had scrambled egg, bacon, boiled eggs, different breads and rolls, cheeses, cold meats such as ham, salami etc, the nicest croissants ever with lots of different condiments for them, fresh fruit and different cereals as well as tons of juice - pineapple, apple, orange, and a couple of others as well as tea and coffee. The gentleman bringing out the food/clearing the plates was so friendly and helpful. The hotel reception is small but nice, the reception staff are amazing and as soon as we arrived the lady gave us a very helpful map with all of the attractions clearly marked and she described the tram stops to us and where to get tickets etc. If you wanted a can of pop/choc bar then they sell these at reception (not cheaply but as to be expected), one night I was in reception using my laptop (free wi-fi!) and the night receptionist kindly offered me a tea/coffee or juice, free of charge. When we left we had a late flight but as with all hotels had to be checked out by a certain time (midday I believe), and they were happy to hold our suitcases behind reception whilst we wandered the city for a few more hours. The rooms were comfortable, and our beds were AMAZING! I have honestly never slept in a more comfy bed in my life, it was like sinking into a giantmarshmallow, I did not want to get up in the mornings! The rooms are decorated very nicely, with a safe in the room, flat screen television, a nice bathroom with toiletries and a huge shower, and tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The cleaner came everyday and was also very friendly. Due to the smoking ban visitors must go outside to smoke, there is a patio area in the reception, there are only 2 downsides to this hotel but they did not affect our stay - the patio area could do with a revamp - could be turned into a lovely little garden, and the lift was down on the last day of our stay, other than this I cannot fault this hotel - fab customer service, lovely rooms, good location, what more could you ask for, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good staff ...”
Reviews.Author: drhako
