Reviews.Content: The hotel has , close to the Van gough and Reijksmuseum. Our room was triple, it was clean and well decorated. The bathroom is spacious and not a cupboard like in city centre hotels. There is also a big supermarket (Albert Hejin) next to the Museumplein so perfect base. Staff were friendly and very very helpful. Price was very good for Amsterdm. We would certainly stay this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Added To A Great Adeventure”
Reviews.Author: goanjock
Reviews.Content: Well after arriving at Schipol we found our way to the Plaza and to the bus stands. There are two numbers (370 and 197) which for three euro's will take you to within 100m of the hotel. So easy and straightforward, hence a great relaxed start to our trip. From the minute we entered the hotel we were greeted with a lovely smile and welcome from the receptionist we just knew we had made the right choice. Our room (203) was just perfect for our needs. It was clean, spacious with a large flatscreen TV on the wall (not that we used it). There wasn't a hairdryer in the room but reception will provide one with no charge. The bathroom was also large with a great walk-in shower and the bed the comfiest we have ever slept in. Breakfast made for a great start to the day (were also greeted with a friendly good morning from the breakfast cook) cold meats cheese, a selection of organic rolls and bread. Croissants, jams etc. cereals, hard boiled eggs and bacon and scrambled eggs. The breakfast was also topped up as soon as it was required. One small tip is that the coffee isn't very strong so drink a little and then add an expresso. The location is perfect right next to the concert hall and only 5 minutes from the main museums. There is also a tram stop 100m from the hotel if you want to use the tram rather than walk. There is also a supermarket a two minute walk away if you need any bits and pieces. Leidsplein is about a 10 minute walk and from there you can head in to the centre of Amsterdam. Alternatively catch a tram to Central Station or Dam Square and start your exploring from there. There are a few restaurants/bars nearby with Cafe Welling being a traditional Brown Cafe frequented by locals if you just fancy a beer. We also had a fabulous meal with great service and sensible prices at http://www.sardegna.nl/ which is only 5 minutes from the hotel (will review separately).If after a long day of exploring, you are just looking for a cheap and cheerful meal (but still tasty) head to Albert Cuyp Street where there is a market as well as a large number of ethnic restaurants including pizzeria's where you will get good Pizza and Pasta dishes for 5 euro's. From the reception staff to the breakfast cook to the housekeeping the staff were so friendly and helpful and added to a perfect trip to Amsterdam so thank you Museum Square Hotel for contributing to a great adventure.......we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff and large room!”
Reviews.Author: nycatdmt
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Conscious Hotel from March 7 till 13. I was very surprised by the size of the room when we arrived as I was expecting it to be like other rooms in Amsterdam. The bathroom was also a very nice size. The walk-in shower could have easily fit 3 people inside! We stayed in room 20 on the first floor. If you are needing great internet service while there (we had to work a little) then the front desk said that the first floor has the best access to Wi-Fi so consider this when booking your room. My only problem with the first floor is that you can here EVERYTHING that goes on in the lobby and breakfast room. SO if you think about sleeping late you don't want to be on the first floor. The location of the hotel is wonderful. There is a stop on the #16 tram basically outside the hotel and the #5 just around the corner. You are close to the museums as well. Amsterdam is a great walking city so you are never far away from most of the sights. My last great recommendation for this hotel would be the staff. All are very friendly and very knowledgeable about the city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: khnorthernireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3-night stay at this hotel with my husband and our 18-month old son. Booked it after reading reviews on this site, and wasn't diasppointed. Transfer from the airport was really simple (3 euros pp on the bus almost direct to the door!) and the location was great (although we tended to walk everywhere rather than use public transport!). Staff were excellent - they could not have been more helpful - and the room and breakfast were good. I would definitely recommend this hotel - excellent value, great location and wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RobfromTheUK
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Tripadvisor and booked it based on all the positive reviews i had seen. I wasn't disappointed! This is a fantastic hotel in a great location, staffed by some very happy and helpful people! Located on De Lairessestraat just south of Museumplein, the hotel is a mere 10-15 minute walk from Lidesplein (a main restaurant /nightlife spot - Hard Rock Cafe!) and about 30 mins to walk to major attractions like Anne Franks house etc. The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum are only 5-10 mins from the hotel. The room i had (408) was ideally located on the top floor at the back in the corner. The room was clean, tidy, well appointed and basically everything i had hoped for! The bathroom was pretty big, with a large shower cubicle and plenty of space. The room was equipped with a large flat-screen LCD tv, with a fair few cable/digital channels - including BBC1 and BBC2, a desk/work area with chair, another easy-chair and a large wardbrobe with a built in safe. The beds by the way are incredibly comfortable!!!! Breakfast in the morning was more than i was expecting, based on some previous reviews. A good selection of fruit juices, cereals, cold meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacon and breads were on offer and all were very nice. They also have one of the best coffee machines ever! The breakfast room is light and airy, mainly located in a conservatory at the back of the hotel. The conservatory opens up onto a small garden, with facilities for smokers. The rest of the hotel is very clean, light & airy with a very modern feel. The main feature of this hotel is by far its customer service. The hotel seems to have at least 4-5 main members of staff who work on reception at various times, but all were very polite, cheerful, very helpful and couldn't do enough to make our stay a pleasent one. Even going so far as to check-in our flights for us and printing our boarding cards before we left. Couldn't have asked for more! We travelled to the hotel via the Connexions hotel shuttle bus service from Schipol. For 23.50 return it took us right to the hotel, no fussing around with trams or trains! However, when you book your return time to the airport 24 hours before your due to leave, make sure the hotel gets a confirmation number from the bus company! We nearly didn't get back to the airport on time due to a miscommunication! A small annoyance, but luckily corrected at the last minute! The only things i would recommend to improve the hotel are: tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, slightly brighter lighting in the rooms and better sound-proofing on the doors (people coming and going late in the evening can be heard clearly) On the whole, this is a fantastic hotel! If i ever go back to Amsterdam, i will surely be booking here again! PS. If you want the best steak you'll ever eat, a short walk to CafÃ© Loetje on Johannes Vermeerstraat is the destination for you! Get there early (7pm) and put your name down for a table, as we waited an hour on our second visit, but its worth it! An obviously popular choice with the locals (hardly any tourists) its a noisy, bustling place with traditional Dutch decor, great service, cheap beer and as i said, simply the best steak your ever going to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but.....”
Reviews.Author: GemsNI
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Amsterdam and chose to stay in this hotel based on the reviews of other travellers. The hotel is clean and brightly decorated and on check in the staff were very friendly. There are only a few double beds available so we had two single beds pushed together with their own separate duvets. When we asked for an extra pillow, we could not be helped as unfortunately this would mean taking one from another guests room!! The lighting in the room was quite poor also. But the biggest problem we had was house keeping beginning their morning routine after 8.30am. The cleaners made a lot of noise in the hallways outside our room and a lie in was completely out of the question. I understand that for most tourists an early start in the morning is the norm,however, this was intended to be a relaxing holiday, so we had the 'do not disturb' sign on the door, this was ignored and our door was knocked on several occasions, followed by our room phone ringing!! When we asked at reception why we had been phoned, staff seemed unaware that we had the do not disturb sign on the door, however were quite insistent that 'every other hotel' begins house keeping as early and were slow to offer any apology for the disturbance. Breakfast was included in our package, however, if i had to pay for this as an extra i would have been quite disappointed with what was on offer- the breakfast room was freezing too! As I said, the location is excellent, the hotel is clean, and i would recommend it if you are an early bird - maybe i just needed more sleep to appreciate it more!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, good location and beds to die for!”
Reviews.Author: Lindie05
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Amsterdam and had done alot of research into where to stay, I wasn't disappointed. This hotel was a fantastic find, really good location, clean spacious rooms with the biggest most comfiest bed I have ever slept in! Staff were very friendly and helpful and advised us about trams, tours etc. I would def recommend this hotel as it was very reasonably priced and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Conservative Quiet Convenient Hotel near Major Museums”
Reviews.Author: hotzhouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. The bed was nice and soft. The room was quiet, very clean, and simple. Convenient in that you could walk to Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. Or one block from tram line #5 which takes you to museums, palace area and central station. The hotel is right on tram #16 which will take youto and from central station. Total cost for one room, two people, two nights was 197.40 Euro (breakfast not included in price - winter rate for breakfast was 9.95 Euro per person). We took #5 tram to Leidlsplein sqaure and ate at Pancake Corner.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy clean comfortable friendly and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: J9HJM
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel better - than expected believe the previous reviews it is such a warm and comfortable experience, the staff are friendly and helpful and should you require anything - ask and it will be done. We arrrived after a very early flight and a room was made ready for us at 9am despite the 2pm check in time - it was most welcome! the reason I have rated the room slightly lower than the rest is due to the very subdued lighting making it difficult to see to do anything never mind read or apply a bit of makeup!! Other than that it was faultless - spacious clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was made fairly much to order and when supplies were low and we asked for more it was brought in quickly. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab beds”
Reviews.Author: Alyson_Thornton
Reviews.Content: We got a great 3 nights for 2 deal on this hotel and had good expectations from the reviews posted. We weren't disappointed. We got the 197 bus straight outside Schiphol Airport (between stops 9-13, I think). This cost â‚¬3 each (off peak), which isn't included in the IAmsterdam transport card. Don't bother with the train, the bus is much more convenient for this hotel. We were able to check in early as they had the room ready and as everyone has said, staff on reception are really friendly and helpful. They gave us a map which they marked with the best routes to take to get around and this had the tram numbers on, which was invaluable. We stayed in Room 020 on the ground floor at the front of the hotel on the first night as it was the only double room left, and I had requested one. The room was large and the bathroom was fab, with a massive walk-in shower. The bed was really comfortable, so much so that I'm going to invest in a feather mattress topper! The only problem with this room was the noise- from other guests coming past Reception and a delivery at 4am in the morning as I'm a very light sleeper. However, this was easily resolved and the next morning we were given a new room (101). Again, this was at the front of the hotel, but the traffic noise from the road didn't bother me. It was a good sized room, with 2 good size single beds pushed together and a nice bathroom. We had a great nights sleep. Breakfasts were good, there was a hot drinks machine (no coffee/tea in rooms, but you can pay â‚¬2 out of breakfast hours for a coffee etc..) and a toaster, plus the usual cereals, yoghurts, cheese, meats, croissants and hard-boiled eggs etc.. You are able to borrow a hairdryer from Reception, which is handy if you're trying to keep hand luggage to a minimum and even a travel adapter (if you manage to forget one like we did!) and the usual iron/ironing board. Dining in Amsterdam isn't cheap (we'll research set menus next time!) We tried the Pizzeria nearby (turn left out the hotel, take a right at the traffic lights and it's right in front of you). We had a pasta/ pizza main meal (the veggie lasagna portion wasn't massive, but it was nice!) , desserts and 2 beers/ small tumblers of wine for â‚¬50. The beer at â‚¬3.50 a pint was the cheapest so far! There are plenty of cafes and bars serving cheaper food. Try the bitterballen (a soft potato and meat mixture and served with mustard for dipping) or the pea soup- both delicious! This was our second visit to Amsterdam, and there is still loads we want to see and do. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The IAmsterdam cards are good value for money if you plan to visit at least 3 of the museums, include a canal cruise and a couple of tram journeys. Check out the site http://www.iamsterdam.com/en/visiting/iamsterdamcard for what is and isn't included.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Chantsss
Reviews.Content: This was such a beautiful hotel, it was clean with a lovely bathroom and a large selection of food at breakfast. TV with lots of channels on and very comfortable,large beds. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and let us leave our bags there after checking out as well. We were so glad we choose this hotel rather than one in the centre. Amsterdam is a small place so walking to anywhere is easy or cycling. There are also regular trams from round the corner and you can get a 4day travel pass including to and from the airport for 25euros. Hotel should be rated 4 star in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “a really frindly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lollyBrighton
Reviews.Content: Close to the Van gough and Reijksmuseum, handy for bus to and from the airport and transport anywhere in Amsterdam. Our room was large with excellent bathroom facilities . The room was clean and warm and very comfortable (-8 outside !) . there were tea and coffee making facilities in the room and a large flat screen TV too. Breakfast was buffet style - cartainly adequate but not spectacular .The staff were so very friendly , nothing was too much bother and we thank them for their attentiveness and efficiency. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine - despite a few problems”
Reviews.Author: IFCUK
Reviews.Content: The eco bit is over played, and the worst part of that was having room lighting so dim that we had to use a torch to unpack. Low wattage is fine in theory, but putting it in a dark woven shade kills any light at all. There were bedside LED lights but one was broken. The staff could not be more friendly or helpful. They arranged a standard lamp so we could see. This had a 40 watt bulb and was brighter than the rest put together. Otherwise to read anything we had to go into the bathroom! The lift kept breaking down, and we were caught in it once. Being on the second floor the walk was not too bad. Despite the negatives, it was a nice place and the staff were very friendly and cared. Breakfast was good, its location is reasonably good [ actually a few hundred metres from Museumplein] and very easy and comfortable. No problem at all with going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location for a great price! Amazing beds!”
Reviews.Author: shinysheep
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 2 years ago before it was refurbished and rebranded. I booked it again as it was in a great location and looked even better than before. Before it was a normal hotel really but the new tree theme throughout makes it modern and stylish. The rooms are a good size and the beds are so cosy, especially on a cold winter weekend. I had the best nights sleep! The bathroom is also spacious and not a cupboard like in some city centre hotels. Its in a great location close to the tram stop, and the museums. Good selection at breakfast, although it pays to go early! Would definaltely stay here again. Friendly staff and good informaiton provided.

Reviews.Title: “the poster hotel for customer service”
Reviews.Author: Shar_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The staff, the staff, the staff. What can we say - they are wonderful, so helpful, so knowledgeable about a city they really love. No request was too much trouble for them. We were snowed in and had to change travel arrangements back to the UK and they let us use the phones for free, and even dialled some information for us. Free wireless internet only worked downstairs in the reception area but hey it worked. The rooms were really big, the beds a little uncomfortable but ok. Close to transport, tourist venues, museums etc. Would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Cold New Year 2009 but warm welcome at Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELITENOW
Reviews.Content: Really recommend this hotel especially for friendliness of reception, in particular Roel who helped us with getting around Amsterdam and booking our on-line check-in for our return flights. Great Guy with cool sense of humour! If only all hotel reception staff had the same upbeat and helpful attitude. The lady who came from the same town as Roel was very friendly too! (sorry don't have her name). Hotel was in a great location for us too. Just over the road from the main Amsterdam New Year outdoor concert. This was even free! What a refreshing change. Only negative was cost of drinks and food in Amsterdam. (Â£5.00 for a pint of beer in most bars). The exchange rate didn't help I suppose. Will go back again though as the friendliness of the people make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: pinkprint
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night trip, fantastic hotel, friendly helpful staff, clean warm and more than adequate facilities in the rooms including plenty of tea and coffee. Breakfast is enough to keep you going but try to get down early as it isn't replenished too often and unfortunately some people are very greedy! Get the 197 or 370 bus from the airport it drops you off and picks you up right near the hotel and is alot cheaper than a taxi ride! (7 euros as opposed to 40 euros!) We got 24hr GVB tickets for travelling around this includes trams,buses and the metro great value for 7 euros - don't forget to touch the tickets on the machines as you get on and exit the trams otherwise your ticket becomes invalid. you can also get 1hr tickets for limitless travel for 2.60 euros. - you can purchase tickets on trams and buses and you don't have to have the correct change which is great when you only have notes! Hotel is about a 15 min walk into the centre but is in a nice quiet location just a couple of mins walk to the Van Gough Museum and tram and bus links are good. We would definately return to this hotel and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Amsterdam.. should be more stars”
Reviews.Author: DutchFrans
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently upgraded, as I learned from the very modern website. It says three star hotel, and the price whas accordingly (80 euro's for a double room) but the quality was far better. A large room, clean bathroom and bath. Coffee and tea (with a hot water boiler) in the room. It is located opposite to the Concertgebouw and offers much better value for money than the other hotels nearby which I checked out while preparing this one day outing. It is wonderful to be able to walk back to the hotel after a concert. Even when you did not buy tickets in advance (www.concertgebouw.nl) you can check if latercomers did not show up and buy their tickets. The hotel is near the Museumplein with the Van Gogh Museum within 3 minutes and the Rijksmuseum about 7 minutes. The Leidseplein about 10 minutes and the citycenter (Dam) about 20 minutes walk. The area in which this hotel is, is the best area of town, safest and very luxureous housing. Parking only on the street, at 4 euro an hour, from 9 to 24 h.

Reviews.Title: “WELL WORTH A SECOND VISIT”
Reviews.Author: Bar&Mar
Reviews.Content: Staff were very good. Very helpful and courteous. The hotel is a bit pricey, but most things are in Amsterdam. Room was fantastic. Good size and a very good sized bathroom. This hotel is a bit of a way out from city centre, but is very close to the main museums and the Vondelpark. It is about 15 minutes walk to the outer edge of the canal ring. Transport links (tram and buses) are fantastic, and if you are brave (or mad) enough the hotel hires bicycles. Great area for restuarants and clothes shops. Very easy to get to the airport from here by taxi or the Conexxion Hotel Shuttle bus (about 15-20 mins). All-in-all a Great Hotel in a Great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, genuine friendly and knowledgeable staff - good choice”
Reviews.Author: wisteriaSussex
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend at this Hotel in Amsterdam. We received a warm welcome from Lissan who exceeds all expectations as a host of a hotel. She was full of knowledge that she couldnt wait to share with us. Nothing was too much trouble for her. She obviously loves her hotel and Amsterdam and wanted us to get the best out of our trip. The hotel is comfortable, (quirky) the beds are amazing, loved having tea and coffee in our room. I guess in the summer the noise from the main road could be irritating, but youre in Amsterdam - no where will be deathly quiet! Breakfast was sufficient to fuel us enough to walk all over Amsterdam. The 197 bus from the airport drops you almost outside the hotel for 3Euros a person- 20 min journey. Great if you love your musums, but you are only a 10 minute walk to first main drag of nightlife and restaurants and about 30 min walk from main city. Of course there are plenty of travel options - tram and bus, but Amsterdam is lovely - worth the walk! Thanks Lissan and team for a lovely stay. Will definitely be singing your praises to anyone who asks. Debbie and Gary x

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: mancmark
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bargain for the price we paid. We had a double room for 2 nights. Getting to the hotel from Schipol airport was easy. we took the 197 from the airport and for 3 euros each it dropped us a 2 min walk from the hotel. Once we arrived we were warmly welcomed. The hotel and the rooms are very clean. The only slight downside we experienced was there is currently building work being carried out on the back of the hotel so we were woken up at 9am by drilling right outside our window. I got up and went down to reception and they moved us straight away to a road side room. The noise from the traffic was a little noisy but miles better than the drilling. i would ask the hotel before you go when the building work will stop. other than that though are stay was extremely pleasant. it is only a 5/10 minute walk through a nice park from the hotel to the van gogh museum which is pretty central. There is also a supermarket right near by if you need any bits and bobs.

Reviews.Title: “Great find with beds to die for...”
Reviews.Author: Boo73
Reviews.Content: Stepping off the plane at Schipol and catching a bus to Museumplein within moments makes this a very easy hotel to reach. Local buses are way cheaper than the airport shuttle bus which collect passengers from various hotels in Amsterdam. The hotel is a stone's throw from the the Concertgebouw and the green spaces of Vondel Park and Museumplein. The rooms are spotlessly clean, with woodland scenes on one wall, sounds naff but isn't. The forest motif runs through to the log cut bedside tables. The best thing of all are the small but perfectly formed antennae like bedlights which are moveable and can shine directly onto a book without disturbing your companion. Staff were very helpful and keen to please, helpfully storing luggage as we squeezed an extra hour or two out of Amsterdam. Beds are wonderful, great sheets, wonderful to collapse into after a hard day cycling or walking. Breakfast is ~14 Euros and is taken in a room just off the lobby, you sign for it on the day and then pay up at the end. Nice little garden at the back. Only gripe was the noise from the busy road, if this matters then ask for a room at the back. Easy to get into central Amsterdam, walking, tramming (no 16) or getting a canal boat. Highly recommended and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisy40
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now and since trip in 2008 it has been updated. The staff are marvellous especially Lizanne the receptionist. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff and they were so helpful. Only gripe was breakfast could have been slightly better with more variety

Reviews.Title: “Staff Really Helpful”
Reviews.Author: linneaw
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five nights at this hotel - this was my first proper trip to Amsterdam (before was only a brief trip on business). The hotel is a little out of the main hub of Amsterdam, close to the main concert hall, Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum. However, it is only about a 15-20 minute walk in to the main part of the town (cut across the grass opposite the concert hall) or you can get on a No 3 or No 5 tram - again opposite the concert hall. There is a supermarket close by the tram stop as well - Albert Heijn (it is underground) if you need to get any vital supplies. The reception staff at the hotel are incredibly helpful, they will help you with any information about ANYTHING! I particularly liked the gentleman who looked a little like Arsene Wenger who was wonderful but all the staff were excellent - couldn't be faulted in any way. The room was large, fairly basic (the room had a balcony with two sets of french doors) and the bathroom (with shower) was very good. The previous reviewer has mentioned the comfy beds - the comfort factor was the feather bed topper, on top of the mattress. My room was at the back of the hotel, so was peaceful - could see a tennis court, some flats, a room in a kindergarten school and lots of trees (did not find the school any disturbance at all). The room also had tea/coffee making facilities and a large flat screen TV - BBC1, BBC News 24 and CNN are a few English speaking channels that could be received. Breakfast is a buffet type. Tea/Coffee, fruit juices, cereals, croissants, bread, bread rolls, few cold meats, scrambled egg, bacon and unusually fruit cocktail. My only small criticism would be that there was no toast making facility - have never stayed anywhere without toast! Amsterdam is a wonderful city and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. There is also an airport bus which leaves every 15 minutes about 200 yards away from the hotel - which is cheap and takes about 20 minutes to get to Schipol - so ideal. If you are making your first trip to Amsterdam - look out for cyclists - everywhere! :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sarahj33
Reviews.Content: Well we are just back from our city break to Amsterdam and wow what a city to visit, this is such a lovely, warm, friendly, relaxed city. Hotel We have stayed in a quite a few hotels and I can honestly say this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. I can't afford top end hotels so have never experienced 5 star luxury but we have stayed from budget to 4 star so quite a mixed bag. Musuem square hotel is the most friendly,clean,welcoming hotel. The staff are such lovely people, all couldnt do enough to make our stay one we would never forget! We got a great welcome, with all the local info so we knew the best places to go, got a map with all the tram lines highlighted so we knew exactly which ones to get about the most efficient way. Location The hotel is based in the museum area which is a really nice area, yes it is a little bit out of the city, but, I would rather that than central station area, which our guide book warned us to stay further out, Amsterdam is not a massive area and as the public transport is so good it really does not matter! I felt safe walking about all the time whether it was early morning, or late at night, yes I was always holding onto my bag but then I always do! The trams are 16 and 5 which we used, the 16 stops right across the road from the hotel but we always got off at concert hall stop which is a 5 min walk. I Amsterdam card I do recommend this purchase, I bought ours off the official website and you take your confirmation e-mail to the tourist office opposite the station, we got a 48 hour one for about Â£45 this had a public transport ticket as well so all of that is included in the price which was so handy as we didnt have to worry about paying for any more tickets when we were there which helped us budget, the first day we paid for a tram ticket, 2 singles and that was 5 euros just that and it was for a hours use! so you do get your money back on these amsterdam cards. What is not included is the train fare from Schipol Airport to Central Station that is 3 euros each one way. On the card we got museums free entrance and a free canal ride, there is 2 to choose from a one hour or one and a half hour trip depending on which side of the city you get the boat, we got the blue boat company near hard rock cafe as that is the side of the city we were staying. Although we did use the trams a lot, and I mean a lot, we also walked loads, take comfy shoes, i thought mine were comfy but after 3 days solid walking they weren't such a good choice, but this is not to say that you have to walk as much as we did as that was just us, you can hop on hop off any tram/bus, your transport card you just have to swipe when you get on and get off the tram, so easy, and if you are not sure where you are then the locals are always helpful in helping you to where you need to go, I also recommend the heineken experience, that is 25% off with the card, that is really great, as is Van Gogh museum, that was free with the card to! Food When you go you must have a pancake, The Dutch can really make pancakes, all the food we had was really lovely, the hard rock cafe as always was super great food. If you are going to visit this city I can honestly say the hotel was fantastic. The beds were a dream, I have never stayed in a hotel bed quite like it, some people have commented on the lights, as it is eco friendly they use energy efficient bulbs so it is quite dim when you first put them on but the rooms are so airy and light and clean, Breakfast was buffet style, hot food was bacon and srambled/boiled eggs and the rest was cereals and rolls,cheeses,hams fruit etc so a good feed We are going back next May for more of a explore as we fell in love with this city and will be staying at the Museum square hotel for sure! I really, really do recommend this hotel and hope my photos help also, not sure what the photos are right at the top of this page and that is not what the hotel looks like??? it is soo much nicer, I would call it boutique sytle, very stylish Sarah & Gary

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not eco-conscious in my opinion.”
Reviews.Author: Corkette
Reviews.Content: The location is ok, we don't mind walking long distances and we also rented bikes for two days straight but it also rained heavily one day and one night so it made for an annoying walk/ride to/from the centre to the hotel. The breakfast is ok - we were sick of it by the 3rd morning. If you are not big on breads, toasts, cereals for breakfast then you are out of luck; eggs are watery and the ham is extremely salty. The beds are amazing. Our room was very large and had nice large, open windows to the front street (street noise did not bother us). No complaints about our room. Enjoyed the coffee/tea pot in our room. Our biggest complaint is that they tout themselves as a eco-concious hotel and this is why we chose this one over another hotel that we were torn between. I could easily list about 30 different ways they could improve their eco-consciousness. I didn't feel like I was staying in an eco-conscious hotel by any means. Our biggest raves are the front desk service. ABSOLUTELY amazing. Everyone was so friendly, informative and helpful. They loaned us an umbrella, called Paris to help us return our rental car, gave us wonderful maps, answered any and all of our questions thoroughly and most importantly -- they did it cheerfully!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NAD71
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with friendly and informative staff. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay for the IBC.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: KentPauljoy
Reviews.Content: The Museum Square Hotel, Amsterdam is delightful. From the moment we stepped over the threshold on arrival to the moment we left the staff could not have been more helpful. They gave us directions, told us how to use the trams and where to buy the cheapest tickets and were generally delightful to talk to. Room 304 was spacious, comfortable and had a lovely roomy bathroom. It was also at the back of the hotel and away from the noise of the road at the front. The only noise was the sound of children playing at the little school at the back. Breakfast was plentiful and varied and, even better, available until 10.00am! The only downside was the limited amount of restaurants in the area. However, we did find the Italian restaurant recommended by a previous reviewer and agreed how good it was. (Turn left out of the hotel and cross the road. Turn right at the lights and you can see the pizzeria facing you. If you have to wait for a table you can sit in the square with a drink!) We had thoroughly enjoyable 4 days and have made up our minds to return to Amsterdam to see the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice outside of the center of downtown”
Reviews.Author: mceuro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just blocks from the Rijks and Van Gogh museums as well as a major concert hall. It also is right along one of the main tram lines. The cab fare from the airport was reasonable. If you want to be in the center of town, however, it does require a short walk. The hotel was clean, with a modern Dutch aesthetic. For some travelers, the rooms may be a bit spartan, but it worked for me. Room was small but bathroom was a generous size. Beds were comfortable. We did not opt for the breakfast so I can't speak to that.

Reviews.Title: “Eh... photos make it look much nicer.”
Reviews.Author: taylorm_g
Reviews.Content: First things first. The staff was efficient, courteous and friendly. No problems there. The location is great for the museums but not close to canal district. Not a big deal because the trams are quick and easy to catch and it's only a 30 min walk to city center. The bedroom isn't great. At first glance it may look nice, but for the most part it feels like a motel. Even a bit cheesy. All things considered, our stay was perfectly fine. Just don't expect even four stars. More like 3.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheProfessorOxford
Reviews.Content: Like most other reviewers, was impressed by this friendly, comfortable hotel. I had a conference at the Free University, and the tram 5 goes there, as well as into the town centre, so it was all very convenient, as well as perfect for museums. Despite asking for a quiet room, I was given one at the front, from where you get noise from trams, but since I travel with earplugs, this was not a problem. Airconditioning and nice big bed were real bonuses. And you can get a bus direct to and from airport, see http://www.channels.nl/knowledge/22280.html A shame they charge for wifi. I'd rate the hotel as a 5 if this were free (though there were unsecured private networks in range).

Reviews.Title: “Simply Good”
Reviews.Author: Jevinlondon
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms with the hotel (1 triple room and 1 double room with extra bed) for total of 5 adults and 1 child. First of all, like many other reviewers, the location is excellent. If you are travelling light or with only 1 or 2 others, take the bus 370 or 190 if I am not wrong and will take you to the hotel in less than 30minutes, faster and avoiding the hassle of changing from trains to tram. It's location is just fantastic, so close to Van Gogh Museum and from there, you can simply walk to the central of Amsterdam. Upon arriving, was warmly greeted and introduced to the hotel and it's surrounding. All staffs in the hotel were so helpful and friendly during the stay. As for the rooms, I was lucky to get the two rooms side by side located on ground floor, with doors leading to a shared garden (which was also just beside the breakfast garden). The two rooms I got had differences and was nice for me to take note. One has shower and one bathtub. The room and bathroom size was very spacious and as newly refurbished, rooms were also fresh and exciting. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Be mindful that the hotel has a 'green' concept, as such that during the day, rooms are lightly lilted and as night falls, then the room will get brighter, thus do not try to find switch to make the lights brighter during the day. Breakfast was simple, but ample and delightful. The only few recommendations I will make is to include some stuffs in room, like a bin and coffee table in the room as they had such a big space, as well as a longer curtain panel for the bathtub as water tends to splashed out messily as the curtain panel for the bathtub is very small and does not totally cover up the bathtub. One thing I would advise is to be a bit careful while using the hotel's preferred car company. This is in no way hotel's fault. As I try to book a day trip out of Amsterdam, I was quoted quite a high price to go visit windmill and the flower auction place. On the day of departure, I also booked a car to the airport which the price was aright. But I need to say the people operating the car are very money-minded and were always quick to offer a second car or to take you to some place at higher prices. Bear in mind these are not original Dutch people, but foreigners who had settled into the country for long time, like many other parts of major European cities. Thus, do some homework and sums before deciding whether to use the car company. Initially, I do felt the price was a bit high (EUR179.00 for triple with breakfast), but after staying, I realise it was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Endorsement”
Reviews.Author: BWHR
Reviews.Content: If you wish to be just a little out from the city to visit the major art galleries and Vondelpark, this hotel gets our recommendation. The hotel is quiet and well kept, the staff most helpful to ensure you make the most of your stay. Several tram routes are just minutes away to get you into the city. Locally there is a choice of places to eat at sensible prices 50-70 euros for two. They may not be restaurents but if you are watching the spend then they will fit the bill, most nights, service was good at all the ones we tried. Try to get a room at the back, the front is on a busyish road, but the trams do make a noise if you are a light sleeper

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bed and Breakfast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NL_lover
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in May 2009 with my brother. Hotel very clean and tidy, friendly hotel staff always ready to help, give advice, book tours and a taxi back to the Airport as we had a very early flight. Its a quiet hotel near the museums. Theres a convenient tram stop close to the hotel that takes you to the centre of Amsterdam. An excellent breakfast selection. Best B&B hotel I have stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bappa_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Museum square hotel in Amsterdam with my wife and teenage son. If I visit Amsterdam again, I will definitely stay at the Museum Square. The room was very spacious- large in comparison to other hotels in Europe. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. They provided us with all the information we needed so we had absolutely no problem moving about the city on our own. Great hotel giving excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A really great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: einav
Reviews.Content: Spent the first night in another hotel that we wanted to change, and just walked in to this one. What e pleasant surprise! Very helpful front-desk assistant, very big room, extremely clean, newly renovated shower, plasma TV in the room, coffee and tea elements in the room, and an elevator (yes, in Amsterdam!) - just perfect! I have to say, that the prices we saw on-line were un-affordable to us, but walking-in, we were offered very good prices, almost budget-hotel prices... The location is very good - tram 16 stops at the hotel's front door, and other lines are REALLY 2 minutes walk. Bus no. 370 in front of the hotel is 25 minutes from Schiphol airport, no need to take tram to central station and a train to the airport, and also cheaper... Free wireless internet all over, which was very important to me. The only minus I could think about, is that the street is pretty noisy, and we had a room facing the street. The windows are double-glazed, and when you close them there is no noise in the room, but than the windows are closed... I would suggest asking a rare room, if you like your breeze... Other than that - a perfect room in a great hotel! Big supermarket next to the tram station, and a great little italian restaurant nearby called POMPA :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: VivekKolkata
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night because the booking website said it was close to the Schipol Airport since we had an early morning flight but it so was not close. The hotel however was nice with nice big rooms compared to Europian room standards, Checkin and checkout was quick enough and the breakfast was awesome. Receptionist guided me with must sees and must avoids (since I was on my honeymoon). Decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful beginning”
Reviews.Author: tcuirish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in mid April while on a trip with my parents. After a bit of a mis-step with the tram, we found the hotel with ease and the front desk clerk was upbeat and helpful. Our room was ready and huge! I'm used to staying in tiny, cramped hotel rooms in Europe but this room was a wonderful surprise. My parents enjoyed the tea and amenities and it was a close walk to the museums and good restaurants. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaylizzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MSH at the end of March,2009. My wife and I found the hotel after a long treck on the tram and after asking numerous locals the way.(all very helpful). I had done some research on the internet on how to get to the hotel but it was still very difficult to find. The hotel is very small and basic but the rooms are surprisingly quite large and comfortable. (No bedside tables ?) The reception staff couldn't be more friendly or helpful. They were all really good. It was quite noisy while we were there as the hotel was having some alterations done inside on the ground floor. The hotel is situated next door to Concert Gebouw the large concert theatre and across the park from the Rijksmuseum and Van Goff museum. Trams run every few minutes into the centre. Breakfast was served from 7am when all the food is set out. On the first morning we went down a little later and the eggs and bacon were cold. Breakfast could have been a lot better I have to say. (It didn't spoil our stay though) Be careful where you go for a drink, we sat outside a bar in Dam Square and were charged 10 Euros for a small beer and a wine (half measure of UK). (A rip off)

Reviews.Title: “Everyone at the desk was extremely friendly and helpful; it was like staying with your favorite aunts and uncles.”
Reviews.Author: erosetree0312
Reviews.Content: The Museum Square Hotel is a good choice. All of the people at the desk were extremely friendly and helpful. In a way it was like staying with your favorite aunts and uncles. The room was on the small side, but we expected that. It was comfortable. The breakfast had plenty of choices and was very good. The location was at the bottom of the axis of the center of the city, near the concert hall and major museums. It was not at the very center of things, but that was not problem since it was convenient to public transportation and also a nice, healthy walk away from just about everything. You would not be tempted to steal the towels, but everything was neat and noise free.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - very good Hotel, would go back”
Reviews.Author: jkiddscot
Reviews.Content: As a well travelled businessman, I was impressed by this Hotel. as for the noise mentioned by other reviews - I stayed 2 weeks in March and decorating (re-painting) was finished - I prefer a hotel to redecorate than one that looks old, tired and needing a refurb! The rooms (4th floor) are suite size with good views of Eastern Amsterdam The location is as good as Amsterdam gets by the Museum plein park surrounded by all major city museums, down the side of the Concert Hall : the centre of evening activity in the area for people going to the classical concerts. The rooms were (I stayed in 2) clean and what I expect of a 3 star hotel, the widescreen TV had BBC2 which was a bonus. All in all an upmarket Hotel, not that economical at 74 Euros a night, but you get what you pay for! A good part of town

Reviews.Title: “noisy construction and awful lighting, but fantastic staff & location”
Reviews.Author: sh3z
Reviews.Content: Well, first impressions weren't good- we walked in and saw a building site! The reception was being completely re-done, lots of builders, drilling noise etc (which you can hear on the 4th floor). However it looked like it was almost finished by the time we left - i just wish we'd known about it before we booked. All guests given complimentary breakfast (in room) as a result of the building, which was a nice gesture. Typical Dutch fare - cheese, breads, ham, boiled eggs and fruit - usually 13 euros, save your money and find something local on the cheap! I've stayed in Amsterdam before and know how much money you have to spend to get anything bigger than a box - so this hotel was a pleasant surprise for the price. There were 3 of us, but the room was really spacious, clean and modern. Flat screen tv (with a few good english channels - MTV, Comedy Central, BBC etc), large windows and a nice big bathroom with power shower. My only gripe was the lighting - it's rubbish! At night the room is really dreary and dull, not sure if our bulbs needed changing or what, but it was a little hard to see. Only mirror is in the bathroom - with 3 girls staying together we would have appreciated an extra mirror/a full-length but it wasn't much of an issue. Location is excellent - great tram links directly to the centre (take the 5 or the 16), and the museum is only a 5-10 min walk from the Van Gogh museum. There's also a good supermarket 2 minutes away, in case you need any basics like water etc (no minibar in room) I have to finish with a mention of the staff - they were amazing! Lovely lovely people who were so helpful and accommodating at all times. As soon as you walk in they take out a map and mark all the main tourist sites and how to get there from the hotel..and they helped us throughout with all of our questions! They really made the stay pleasant for us. I'd definitely stay again - as long as the construction's completed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: tobyholly
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and I, two late teenage children) spent 3 nights in Amsterdam before Christmas. We wanted an affordable (3-star) hotel in a pleasant part of Amsterdam (away from the station area grot), with easy access to all the sights - plus a good Tripadvisor review! This hotel met these requirements and subsequently exceeded our expectations. Situated just beyond the Concert Hall, the tram stops virtually outside; Riksmuseum canal stop is about 5 mins walk and all of the 'lower' half of the city is an easy walk. Despite an early flight arrival, our rooms were ready at 9.30am. The Dutch hotelier on reception was incredibly helpful and welcoming. He gave us a map with highlighted tram routes (and info on where/how to buy/use tram tickets, often something we find tricky!), good places to eat, generally nice bits of the city to wander round etc; The rooms clean, well-fitted, decent size (ours was actually a large corner room, v nice); breakfast well-stocked (included in hotel price, unusual). Ok, maybe stair carpets a wee bit shabby, but this was a sightseeing break! Nothing too much trouble for staff, would definitely return to this hotel (note it's called 'Leidesplein' in Dutch.) We should also have used the hotel for taxi transfers to Schippol, which would have cost 32.50EUR each way. I made the mistake of pre-booking the Connexion hotel bus transfer via the City-Discovery website (World-Air-Transport) who charged 128EUR for four of us for return tickets with a face value of 21EUR each! (and we would have qualified for a further 10EUR group discount!) So much for a website 'guaranteeing best prices'!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynneH22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in good location. Staff friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble, gave good information on local restaurants and bars. Room spacious, clean and well appointed and the breakfast exeeded all expectations, set us up for the day! After last years terrible experience in the Hotel Mozart, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LGMElderslie
Reviews.Content: This trip was taken by my husband and I (50's) for a 4 night stay, 1st time visit to Amsterdam. Having read the previous reports I had a feeling of disappointment that his was our accomodation. However, I found the Hotel exceeded my expectations. LOCATION. True it is a fair bit from the centre, but the public transport is good. We decided to walk everywhere and there is plenty to see to keep you going. We averaged 12 - 16 miles a day and had very sore feet after 3 days!!! It is near the beautiful Vondelpark, and is next to the museum and fashion quarter which houses all the upmarket designer shops ie Chanel etc. Keep walking and you will come to The Hard Rock Cafe and go a little further and you will come to lots of restaurants etc. For normal shops like H &M, C &A and many other recognisable names head for the streets of Dam Square. Be careful though as the Red Light District is on the other side of Dam Square, (and is well worth a visit) ACCOMODATION. The room was small but very bright and clean. The bathroom was modern. There was a fridge, a safety deposit box, a television, phone, kettle and a welcome pack of tea, coffee etc. The hairdryer was not present, there was a hole in the wall where it once hung but had been removed. This did not bother me as I took my own anyway. If I had reported it I am quite sure a satisfactory outcome would have occurrred. STAFF The staff were all lovely, friendly and very helpful. BREAKFAST. Fantastic and well worth getting up for. Wide range and would satisfy even the fussiest of eaters! The kitchen staff were lovely. There was a variety of cereals, fruit cocktail, fresh fruit, cream bacon, scrambled egg, rolls, toast, bread, meat, cheese, fruit juices, tea and coffee, biscuits etc VALUE As a place to stay for bed and breakfast it is certainly good value for money. However, if you buy crisps, coke, sweets etc these items are expensive. Better to go round the corner and opposite the Concert Hall to the Supermarket (not obvious you have to go down an escalator-beside a car park) where you will find things much more cheaply. At the moment as the Pound is doing so badly against the Euro we found Amsterdam very expensive. PLACES OF INTEREST There are lots of places to go. We visited Anne Franke's House , The red light district, Dam Square,Van Gogh Musuem, The Reijksmuseum, went on a canal boat, visited Madame Tussauds and had a quick look inside a coffee shop which was a real eye opener!!! In short lots to do and lots of places to eat and drink. The Sottish bar off the main shopping street at Dam square is the cheapest in town. Say hello to Linda from Clydeband, Allan, Ray and Eddie who likes to be known as Brian!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that Great”
Reviews.Author: casey9464
Reviews.Content: Speaking from an American perspective this hotel is not all that great, but it's not bad. Location: Awsome location - very very close to museums, Leidsplan, good restaurants. 15 min from Schipol Staff: very nice & helpful Breakast: not the biggest/nicest spread I've seen, but absolutely suitable for a good breadfast with hot and cold foods Actual rooms/bathrooms: the worst part of the experience. the room looked worn & in need of a serious refurb. Carpet looked FIlthy - kept my socks on the whole time. Upon 1st glance the bathroom seemed ok, but upon further inspection was on the icky side. * I could hear all the comings & goings of my neighbors - in fact I thought my room was being broken into mutliple times b/c when the room next to me tried to open their door it was like it was my door. * they take your key from you whenever you leave the hotel and you get it back upon your return. They never ask for an id in order to get the key, you just say your room number. The hotel is small, but not small enough for the rotating staff to know who you are each time you come/go Bottom Line: stay somewhere else if you can afford it - if not, you'll survive but not be thrilled. Check out my actual room pics...although I'd say it looks cleaner in the pics than it did in person.

Reviews.Title: “The best place I have stayed in within Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Briggsey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my birthday with 3 other people and we were looking for a hotel that was reasonably priced within the Liedesplein/Vondelpark district. I had personally read the reviews which all appeared to be favourable and I can honestly say that in no way were we disappointed with our choice. The staff/owners were exceptionally friendly, helpful and very willing to provide maps on which they highlighted tram routes and generally where places of interest were located. The rooms were a good size with a TV and a fridge which was "for our convenience" which I thought was a lovely touch. Most importantly, the bed and pillowswere superbly comfortable and whereas our room at the front of the building on the 4th floor was a little noisy with the windows open, because it had air conditioning we were able to close the windows and sleep peacefully without being too hot. Another member of our party was at the back of the building on the 1st floor which was lovely and peaceful but didn't have air con, however there was a large door/window that could be opened to allow air into the room. This basically meant that wherever you are in the building, you will have a good night's sleep!! We didn't order breakfast as it was continental and we wanted a bigger meal to set us up for the day so I cannot comment on how good/bad/value for money it is, however at the time of our visit, the pound was very weak against the euro which did make everything just that little bit more expensive than I had seen before however this isn't any reflexion on this hotel in anyway. The hotel is within a 5-10 minute walking distance of the beautiful Vondelpark which is wondeful to sit and relax in on a summer's day. There are 3 tram lines within walking distance of the hotel which are Nos 5, 16 and 24 and Leidesplein is only a couple of stops away on tram 5 however Dam Square is only about 10 minutes which meant for us, Museum Square Hotel was ideally situated. On our first night we arrived later in the evening so we opted to eat just around the corner from the hotel and we enjoyed a beautifully cooked steak with sauce, fries with a very pleasant and welcome service. For my birthday we went on a Dinner Cruise which we booked in advance through www.viator.com and cost Â£110 for 2 people but we both considered it to be worth the money once you compare the cost of this to cheaper cruises that do not serve dinner. The cruise began at 8pm so we were able to enjoy the daylight, dusk and nightfall and the beautiful colours of the red light district and lit up bridges reflected in the water during our 2.5 hour trip. The food was gorgeous and we were given complimentary glasses of sparkling wine followed by beers, wine or soft drink which were also included in the cost. If you have the money to spare and would like a romantic evening, this is definitly the way to go, however if you would like to enjoy the sights at a more reasonable cost, there are candlelit cruises for Â£22 per person that last 2 hours. I have visited Amsterdam a few times over the years but mainly in the autumn/winter and as this was my first summer trip and the sun was shining, we chose to treat ourselves and take a 30 minute horse and carriage ride around the cobbled streets which we caught from Dam Square and cost 45 euros regardless of how many people are in the carriage, as there were 4 of us, this worked out relatively cheap and was one of the highlights. You can hire them for longer (an hour) or for less but we felt 30 minutes was perfect. Overall we found the Dutch to be very friendly, helpful and with a laid back un-hurried approach that was conducive to a relaxing time despite the apparent hustle and bustle of a vibrant city. When we return again in the future, myself and the other 3 members of my group will definitly be staying at the Museum Square Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “queens day at museum square”
Reviews.Author: carriemcleod
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel,unknowingly when we booked it over the holiday of queens day ,30th april,so it was all rather different in Amsterdam to what we were expecting. The hotel was quite a walk from the centre but there are trams from a nearby stop(not on Queens day so we walked and walked). The reception staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, actually all the Dutch people were during our stay.its easy to catch a bus from the airport which stops almost outside the hotel and only takes about 25mins. The breakfasts were adequate.but nothing special.There is a fridge in the rooms that you can use for your own purchases eg milk. There is only a shower in the bathrooms and we had twin beds despite booking a double. Everywhere was kept clean although I agree with some others that it needs some refurbishment in decor and carpets in public places.Overall a pleasant stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, good location, could use a refresh”
Reviews.Author: Dave G
Reviews.Content: I just returned from five nights in Amsterdam, four of which I spent at the Museum Square Hotel. The location is great. It's right on a tram line (#16) and practically next door to a number of museums, including the Rijksmuseum and the VanGogh, both of which were great. The front desk staff was very friendly and helped me figure out how to buy and use passes for the tram & bus. The neighborhood has a number of sidewalk cafes and good restaurants to select from and is away from the chaos of Dam Square. The main drawback to this property is that it needs to be remodeled. It just feels tired.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl06
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is an absolute gem! My husband and I spent 7 nights here the first week in April and were delighted by every aspect of our stay. The room was charming and along with the bathroom spotlessly clean. The very comfy beds are made with pristine white duvets and shams without the usual suspiciously unlaundered bedspreads of most hotels. What a plus! Fridge and electric tea kettle with coffee and tea and china cups and saucers in the room made evenings extremely pleasant. The location is perfect if your main interests are the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum, just a 5 minute walk, but all the trams stop nearby, so nothing is really far away. And, the famed Concertgebouw is right on the corner! Breakfast was included with our room and we really enjoyed the convenience and variety in the lovely breakfast room each morning. The staff in this hotel go above and beyond the call of duty! Roel and Lisan are amazing. We took many day trips by train, and they always had train schedules and tram numbers ready for us. Book here with confidence! We'll be back again soon for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: missa_em
Reviews.Content: Museum Square is a low key and simple hotel with an AMAZING staff! Prior to my family's arrival, Roel and his patient and friendly team provided us with a lot of help and information regarding our rooms and the city. With their help, we were able to get our Anne Frank tickets printed, as well as our trip to Keukenhof Gardens arranged and booked. My 10-year-old brother loved the playground next door, as well Vondel Park and the museum park square. The hotel (with its lift and accessible shower room) was very accommodating for my mom, who has a knee disability. The trams nearby stop at the most convenient locations, such as the Central Station and Dam Square. The neighborhood isn't as picturesque as other hotel locations (it's a good ten minute walk to the canals), but there are markets, eateries and cafes nearby. As for our room, it was modern, clean, and comfortable, though the street/tram/traffic noise could be quite loud at times. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Etterose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the Museum district. It is close shopping and trams that will take you anywhere you want to go. The longest tram ride was 15 minutes. The rooms are large and clean. The buffet breakfast was excellent and included in the price of the room. This hotel is a great value for the price. However, what makes this hotel exceptional is the staff. We were 6 couples and were greated by Lissan at the front desk. She got us into our rooms quickly and was very helpful with hint and information about Amsterdam. During our stay my wife became ill and we were unable to leave for our next location. The hotel was booked solid as were just about every other hotel in Amsterdam. The manager, Roel, contacted a doctor to come a treat my wife. He helped us change our airline reservation and after about 2 hours of intense telephone calls he was able to find a room in a hotel nearby at a reasonable price. He didn't stop there, he was able to convince one of his steady customers, that was due to arrive that day, to go to the other hotel so that my wife wouldn't have to move. While I was out getting a prescription filled he check to make sure she was okay. When we go back to Amsterdam we would not consider staying anywhere else and would recommend it highly. John and Antoinette C

Reviews.Title: “Brill stay at Museum square”
Reviews.Author: silvy84
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay at the museum square, we were there for 4 days and found the Hotel an absolute joy! The staff were friendly and informative, even making us breakfast in time for our 6.30am check out! The room was very spacious and had access to a terrace, would be lovely during the summer. When booking the hotel I was under the assumption it was within walking distance from Dam Square, whilst it was prob 30 mins it wasn't exactly ideal for Blustery March Weather. However I wouldn't let this put you off a stay at the Museum Square, as it makes an enjoyable visit to Amsterdam, even better! P.s, Great breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay at the Museum Square”
Reviews.Author: malebron
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the Concertgebouw and the beautiful Museum Square. If the weather is good, the walk up to Leidse Plein, across the museum square, past the rijksmuseum, is a great way to start the day. There is an Albert Heijn supermarket close by, at the edge of Museum Square. It is a small but decent hotel, I spent quite some time there, as I became ill during my vacation (isn't it typical...). The staff were helpful and kind (and offered to help me get a doctor if I needed one), the beds were good and everything worked as it should. We had large windows to the street, which means noise but also a view of Amsterdam buildings, which I enjoyed. One slightly weird detail though: There was a large button for turning the light on and off, on the wall, right above one of the pillow places, on the bed-frame. If you sit up in bed, lean your back against the wall and want to watch TV, for instance, there is no way of NOT accidentally turning the light on and off every time you move your back the tiniest bit. Getting there and back from the airport is really easy, the bus 370, and the much more frequent 197, stop at the bus stop almost right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, quiet, reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherlyLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are light and airy, the beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are spotless and modern. It's in the museum district, a short tram ride to the city centre and a five minute walk to the major museums. Ask for a room in the back, which is exceptionally quiet. It is very reasonable and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: JellyIreland
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms were clean, the location was excellent. Every restaurant recommendation given by the receptionist was spot on. great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PrimeTime22
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect based on some of the reviews of the hotel, but let me tell you...this place is great. The staff (and I don't know their names) where kind and friendly and they helped me practice my limited Dutch. The hotel is situated in the Museumplein area of Oud Zuid. Two tram lines are within 5 minutes of the hotel. My room was on the street side and there was no noise problem. Don't get hung up on breakfast as it is traditionally Dutch (cold cuts, bread etc.). I will definitely stay there again when I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of treasure in beautiful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ido4u
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the hotel we realized the location is great. It was close to everything (Van Joch museum, some beautiful parks, stores).The hotel is very close to K- Tours â€“ in case u are into arranged tours in the city and out of it (very recommended; We took the 4.5 hours trip to Valdam, Dam and more and also the 9 hours tour to the flowers market, maduradam, delfet and more). There is also public transportation outside of the hotel (just be aware of thieves in the bus stop. They can steal your belonging without you even notice- this is of course a tip that is not concern to this amazing hotel). The hotel room was very comfortable and clean. Shower and bathroom are in good shape. Breakfast was quite good; we suggest the hotel manager to add some vegetables to it so it will be perfect. If you are into kosher food you can order that in advance. And above all the reception service was incredible - Very helpful and kind. The hotel manager was extremely nice and helpful too. We would defiantly recommend everyone going to Amsterdam stay in this hotel and we would defiantly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “a complete pleasure”
Reviews.Author: misterfisher2006
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a website I didn't know, so I was nervous when I arrived, but it was lovely. Stayed two nights, and wish I could have stayed longer. The room was quiet, and quite nice, with garden access through a sliding door in the room [I had a ground floor room, which I usually don't like]. Hotel staff was completely helpful and there were two streetcar routes available within a short two block walk. A very quiet neighborhood, felt very safe, but within easy walking distance of museums, restaurants, cafes and the red light district. Please note that the hotel does not allow the use of drugs in its rooms or on hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with very good connection to the centre”
Reviews.Author: fiammybe
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, strategically located in Amsterdam even if not directly in the centre. The room we got was very big, and the reception was able to give us precise directions on how to get to the places we wanted to visit as efficientlyl as possible by public transports. Breakfast was comparable with a hotel of this category: a nice buffet with a good choice of juices, tea, several types of bread, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Brown79
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious and clean. Location was perfect, across the street was a tram stop, walking distance to many attractions including the Van Gough Museum. I would highly recommend and would even stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great finding!”
Reviews.Author: KaruVM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the MSH for two nights, and I really enjoyed it. My room was huge, with a big window, lots of light. Although it is not in the city center, the location is perfect, because you can walk everywhere. To give you an idea, the Van Gogh museum is just two blocks away, the fashion district 300 metres. The breakfast is abundant, and there is a supermarket in the Museumplein and several restaurants and take aways in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna-marie28
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 4th floor, right at the top of the hotel (but there is a lift) and it was larger than I was expecting. We had a lovey view out of the window to the street below. The room was clean and spacious, with three beds, small fridge, a very good selection of tea and coffees (good choice and quantity), and all the other amenities that were advertised. There was noise from the street below, but once the windows were shut, it was gone. There was also a/c available, but we never used it. On the coffee table in the room was also a couple of tourist books and guides which we did enjoy looking through. The breakfast was typical of hotels in Amsterdam, bread rolls, croissants, sliced bread, slices of ham, cheese, salami, cereals, juices, chocolate milk, fruit, hard boiled eggs and a selection of jams and spreads. It was all served in the conservatory at the back of the building which was clean, tidy and generally lovely. We did want to go into the bar one evening, but found out it had not been open for a couple of years, which I think is a shame, as it looks very nice, but instead we decided to get a couple of drinks from reception and take them to our room as they do offer some drinks and snacks at reception. However the lovely lady on reception said we would be really overcharged and instead suggested a local supermarket, which we would never have found without help, and turned out to be a real find! The location was great, close to a lovely park between the Rijksmuseum and the Concert Hall. About a 10 minute walk to the Leidesplein, for lots of restaurants and shops and then a further 10/15 minutes walk to the red light district, dam square and the area near the train station. The Hotel staff could not do enough for us, they were always ready to give directions, suggest places to go and they always asked if we'd had a good day on our way in and wished us an 'enjoy your evening' on our way out. They even knew our room number before asking after just one day. Not sure if that was good thing or a bad thing! I really enjoyed this hotel and thought it was excellent. We stayed for 3 nights in September 2007, and will happily go back there.

HotelInfo.Name: Conscious Hotel Museum Square
HotelInfo.Address: De Lairessestraat 5-7, Amsterdam 1071 NR, The Netherlands
